About the Company

We are a U.S.-based lash & brow studio focused on high client retention, memberships, and strong systems. We are expanding our marketing and follow-up operations and are looking for a Virtual Assistant who can confidently communicate, follow up, and convert inquiries into booked appointments.



This is not an admin-only role.



This role requires confidence, clarity, and professionalism on the phone.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for:

Client communication (phone, SMS, DMs)

Securing appointments and collecting card information

Rebooking and membership conversations

Outreach and coordination

Writing and improving scripts used for client communication



Key Responsibilities



1. Phone Support & Appointment Securing

Answer incoming calls from potential and existing clients

Return missed calls promptly

Explain services and pricing clearly

Secure appointments and collect credit card information

Handle basic objections professionally

Follow provided compliance and security guidelines



2. Script Creation & Optimization (REQUIRED)

You will write and refine:

Phone call scripts

SMS follow-ups

Rebooking messages

Membership upgrade scripts

Influencer and local outreach messages



Scripts must be:

Clear

Friendly

Conversion-focused

Natural (not robotic)



3. Client Follow-Ups

Follow up with new leads

Follow up with recent clients for reviews

Re-engage clients who haven’t rebooked

Track communication outcomes



4. Influencer & Local Outreach

Research and contact influencers

Coordinate collaborations

Create and send contracts

Schedule collaborations with artists

Manage 3–5 collaborations per month

5. Social Media & Content Support

(~1–2 hours/day)

Post content and stories

Create simple graphics in Canva

Follow brand guidelines



6. Training Day & Model Coordination

Post model calls

Coordinate and confirm models

Day-before and day-of confirmations



Schedule

Start: 20–25 hours/week

Split-shift availability required:

Morning

Midday

Evening (U.S. time zones)



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

C2 English or near-native fluency

Confident speaking on the phone with U.S. clients

Experience handling calls, objections, and bookings

Comfortable asking for payment and commitments

Strong written English

Organized and detail-oriented

Stable internet and quiet work environment



Nice to Have

Appointment-setting or sales support experience

Beauty or service-based business experience

CRM or booking system experience



How to Apply

Please include:

A short introduction

Your phone support experience

Confirmation of C2 English fluency

One example of a phone or SMS script you’ve written

Your availability

Internet speed

Applications without script examples will not be reviewed.

title: Video Editor for E-commerce Ads
description:
Hello!



We run several branded e-commerce stores in the Nordic market and are looking for a Video Editor for Ads to join our team long-term. This is an execution role focused on creating high-performing ad videos, not influencer or vlog-style editing.



What you’ll do:



• Edit ad videos using provided B-rolls and assets

• Create videos from pre-written scripts and sometimes write scripts yourself

• Generate and integrate AI voiceovers

• Sync subtitles accurately with audio and visuals

• Structure videos for performance (hooks, pacing, clarity)

• Adapt and translate videos for different markets

• Analyze existing ads and improve them

• Follow SOPs, templates, and internal guidelines



Tools & workflow:



• Main tool: CapCut (experience here is important)

• Clear instructions and examples are always provided

• You must follow instructions precisely and think independently when needed

• We use AI tools as part of our workflow



Workload & schedule:



• Starting at ~10 hours per week

• Flexible working hours

• Can increase to 30–40 hours per week if performance is strong



Requirements:



• Video editing experience or solid practical knowledge is required

• Must be a fast learner and comfortable with modern tools

• Strong attention to detail

• Able to work independently and solve problems

• Reliable and consistent



We value:



• Strong execution

• Willingness to learn and improve

• Long-term mindset

• Creative thinking combined with structure



Growth opportunities:



This role is ideal for junior to intermediate editors who want to grow into a high-level ad editor over time, with increased pay based on performance. This is a long-term role, and high performers can grow into roles such as:



• Senior video editor

• Creative strategist

• Ads / performance-focused roles



How to apply:



Send a short message explaining why we should choose you, and start your application with the word “strawberry” so we know you read everything.

title: WFH OUTBOUND TELEPHONE RECRUITER - Php 50-60K Base + High Commissions!!!
description:
Salary: Php50,000 – Php60,000 / month base + very generous commissions



Potential Earnings: Php100,000 – Php250,000 / month or more (after 3–6 months)



RLS is a global recruiting and consulting firm, expanding our remote team in the Philippines. We are seeking highly confident, outgoing, friendly, and very highly motivated Telephone Recruiters / Telephone Salespeople with strong English language skills and very light or no accent to make outbound calls to current and prospective clients across the United States.



This is a full-time, work-from-home position with excellent growth potential and strong earning opportunities.



What We Offer:

- Guaranteed base salary: Php50,000 per month or higher (based on experience)

- Very generous commissions - our top performers earn Php100,000–Php250,000 per month or more after 3-6 months of work with us 

- Paid time off after 6 months:

    1 week paid vacation

    3 paid sick days 

    3 paid personal days

- Long-term, stable employment

- Supportive team + training provided

- 100% remote (WFH)



Role Responsibilities:

Make 100+ outbound dials per day to current and potential clients in the US (see Please Note below)

Update call records and maintain tracking sheets.



PLEASE NOTE : Many calls will not be answered, making it very manageable to hit the daily call target.



What We’re Looking For:

Fluent spoken English with very light or no accent.

Clear, friendly, warm, and articulate speaking voice.

Strong phone confidence and excellent communication skills.

Highly motivated, reliable, and committed to success.

Ability to work Monday–Friday, 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM US Eastern Time.

A quiet home workspace, stable internet, and noise-canceling headset.

Experience in recruiting, sales, or CSR is preferred but not required.



How to Apply

Please send:

Your resumé

Link to your 1-2 minute video recording introducing yourself and explaining why you’d be great in this role.



Important Notice

Due to the large volume of applications we receive, we can only respond to candidates whose profiles match what we are looking for. We sincerely appreciate your understanding.



JOIN US!

If you have an excellent phone presence, strong motivation, and a desire to earn six-figure monthly income, we want to hear from you!

title: ClickUp Systems Architect & Automation Specialist (Agency Operations)
description:
We are looking for an experienced ClickUp Systems Architect to help us consolidate and systemise operations for a growing web design and digital marketing agency.



At present, our infrastructure is spread across tools such as Slack, Google Drive, Google Sheets, and documented SOPs. Part of this engagement will involve reducing tool sprawl by moving communication, workflows, and task management into ClickUp wherever appropriate.



Certain platforms — such as Go High Level (GHL) — will remain core systems and must be integrated cleanly into the overall workflow.



This role is about designing ClickUp as the central operating system, not simply maintaining an existing setup.



What You’ll Be Working With



Existing SOPs and partial documentation



Slack-based communication and handovers (to be reduced or replaced)



Google Drive and Google Sheets used for tracking and reporting



Go High Level (GHL) as a core CRM and automation platform



A team delivering web design, SEO, ads, and content services



You will work closely with the agency owner and key tea
mbers to:



Map how work currently happens



Identify what should move into ClickUp



D
 what should remain external (e.g. GHL)



Build a cleaner, more scalable operating system



Key Responsibilities

Process Mapping & Tool Consolidation



Work with leadership and tea
mbers to map existing workflows



Identify inefficiencies, duplication, and tool overlap



Design a ClickUp-first operating model where appropriate



Reduce reliance on Slack by shifting workflows, updates, and approvals into ClickUp



ClickUp Architecture & Build



Design the overall ClickUp workspace structure (Spaces, Folders, Lists)



Build workflows for different service lines (web, SEO, ads, content)



Create status flows that reflect real delivery stages



Build task templates, dependencies, and custom fields



Automation & Integration



Build advanced ClickUp automations



Integrate ClickUp with Go High Level (GHL) where required



Use n8n to connect systems where native automations are insufficient



Reduce manual handoffs between tools



Documentation & Enablement



Document systems, workflows, and logic



Create Loom walkthroughs or written SOPs



Support internal handover and adoption



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



You must have:



Deep experience designing and building ClickUp for agencies or service-based businesses



Strong understanding of ClickUp architecture and advanced automations



Experience consolidating workflows across multiple tools



Ability to work from incomplete or evolving process documentation



Confidence explaining why certain tools should be replaced, retained, or integrated



Highly Desirable (Bonus Skills)



Experience with n8n or similar automation tools



Experience integrating ClickUp with CRM platforms such as Go High Level



Background working with digital marketing or web agencies



Strong systems-thinking and documentation skills



Engagement Type



Project-based engagement to start



Potential for ongoing optimisation and systems ownership



Scope, timeline, and budget to be agreed



How to Apply (Important)

title: Real Estate/Property Manager Assistant
description:
I am a Real Estate Broker who does property management (about 45 properties) and sales.  I am a discount agent for sales where I split my commission 50/50 with my Buyers and  charge only 1% for my Sellers. If possible, I would like to hire full time but work 7 days a week for 6 hours each day, Noon-6pm Hawaii time.  

Responsibilities:

* Handle incoming maintenance request calls from tenants and property owners

* Coordinate with approved vendor network via text and phone to schedule maintenance appointments

* Follow maintenance requests through to completion, ensuring proper communication between all parties

* Manage and respond to leads from Zillow, Avail, and other real estate platforms

* Schedule property showings and appointments for both property management and sales

* Maintain and update social media presence for the brokerage

* Provide general administrative support and help clear administrative backlogs

* Input and manage data in Buildium property management software

* Assist with website maintenance and updates

Requirements:

* Strong customer service and communication skills with neutral, professional accent

* Experience with property management or real estate operations preferred

* Proficiency with CRM and property management software (Buildium experience a plus)

* Ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities simultaneously

* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

* Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

* Reliable internet connection and professional phone manner

Scope:

* Part-time position starting at 20 hours per week with potential to expand to full-time

* Flexible scheduling based on business needs and peak call times

* Primary focus on maintenance coordination with additional administrative and marketing support

* Direct reporting to broker owner with opportunity for increased responsibilities as business grows

* Mix of inbound customer service calls and proactive outreach for lead management

* Access to company systems including Buildium, Zillow, and other real estate platforms

description:

title: Ecommerce CRO Specialist / UX UI
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Ecommerce CRO Specialist

AI-Powered Conversion Rate Optimization & Landing Page Architect





Role Type

Full-Time / Contract

Department

Growth & CRO

Reports To

Head of Ecommerce

Location

Remote





THE OPPORTUNITY

We’re looking for a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist who lives and breathes ecommerce performance. You won’t just audit pages and hand off recommendations—you’ll own the full optimization cycle: diagnosing conversion leaks, architecting higher-performing pages, and using AI tools (primarily Claude) to rapidly prototype, design, and code upgraded landing page experiences.

This role is for someone who thinks like a strategist, executes like a builder, and communicates like a creative director. You’ll screenshot our existing pages, sit with AI to reimagine them, produce polished visual plans, and deliver ready-to-implement page blueprints that move customers from scroll to sale.

WHAT YOU’LL OWN

You’ll be responsible for the complete CRO roadmap across our ecommerce storefront, including but not limited to:



Home Page Redesign — Structure the hero, trust signals, navigation flow, and CTAs to maximize click-through and session depth.

Step Funnel Optimization — Map and refine every stage of the purchase funnel—from first click to checkout confirmation—eliminating friction at each transition.

BOGO Offer Pages (Multiple Variants) — Build toggle-scroll layouts with strategic upsell placements for BOGO 1, BOGO 2, and hybrid bundle offers (e.g., Buy 1 Mat Get 2 Ropes Free).

Collections & Bundle Architecture — Redesign the All Collections page plus unique collection experiences for Pre-Built Bundles, Ropes, Gears, and other product categories.

Membership / Free Trial Funnel — Architect the Timeless Jump Club free trial flow—from hook to sign-up to upsell—so it converts browsers into committed members.

Brand Story & Trust Pages — Optimize “Why Timeless” and “About Our Story” pages to build emotional connection and credibility that supports conversion across the entire site.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Audit existing pages by screenshotting them and running structured AI-driven analysis sessions using Claude to identify conversion gaps, UX weaknesses, and missed revenue opportunities.

Prompt Claude to generate improved layouts, copy hierarchy, visual wireframes, and front-end code for landing pages, funnels, and offer pages.

Produce full-scope CRO plans for each page—including annotated before/after visuals, strategic rationale, and implementation specs—then present them to the team.

Design and optimize upsell flows, toggle-scroll mechanics, and bundle page architecture that maximize AOV without degrading the customer experience.

Continuously A/B test, iterate, and refine based on data—heatmaps, session recordings, GA4, and platform analytics.

Collaborate cross-functionally with creative, media buying, and product teams to ensure CRO insights feed back into the broader growth engine.

AI & CLAUDE PROFICIENCY (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

This is not a “nice to have.” Your daily workflow will involve:

Screenshotting live pages and feeding them into Claude with structured prompts to extract actionable optimization insights.

Prompting Claude to generate high-fidelity visual concepts, interactive mockups, and production-ready front-end code (HTML/CSS/Liquid/React).

Building and refining prompt frameworks that consistently produce professional-grade outputs—not rough drafts.

Using Claude to rapidly iterate on page variations, test copy angles, and simulate customer decision paths before pushing live.

If you’ve never sat with an AI tool for hours building real deliverables, this role will feel foreign. If you’ve done it and loved it, keep reading.

REQUIREMENTS

3+ years of hands-on ecommerce CRO experience (DTC / Shopify / headless preferred).

Proven track record of improving conversion rates, AOV, and revenue per session through page-level optimization.

Deep familiarity with landing page best practices: visual hierarchy, offer framing, urgency/scarcity mechanics, social proof placement, and mobile-first design.

Strong working knowledge of analytics tools: GA4, Hotjar, Microsoft Clarity, or equivalent heatmap/session recording platforms.

Demonstrable experience using Claude (or comparable AI) to produce visual designs, code, and strategic plans—not just text chat.

Ability to communicate optimization plans clearly with annotated visuals, strategic write-ups, and structured presentations.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where shipping beats perfection.

BONUS POINTS

Experience with Shopify Liquid, custom theme development, or headless CMS builds.

Background in direct-response copywriting or offer architecture.

Familiarity with subscription/membership funnel optimization.

Experience managing or mentoring junior CRO or design tea
mbers.

HOW TO APPLY

Send us a short Loom (under 5 minutes) where you screenshot one of our live pages, walk us through what’s broken, and show us how you’d use Claude to fix it. That’s worth more than any resume.

Include your portfolio or case studies showing before/after CRO results on ecommerce pages.



We don’t need someone who knows CRO theory. We need someone who builds pages that sell.

title: Video Editor
description:

3) Organizing all content, files, and progress clearly in shared sheets.

Best regards,

Tess

title: Social Media Outreach VA
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Social Media Outreach

Virtual Assistant





Position Type:

Virtual Assistant — Contract / Part-Time to Full-Time

Schedule:

Monday–Friday (Daily Outreach Required)

Hours:

4–8 Hours/Day (Flexible Timezone)

Reports To:

Brand Owner / Marketing Lead

Tools:

Shopify, Instagram, TikTok,
, Google Sheets, Notion or Trello





ROLE OVERVIEW





We’re looking for a highly organized, proactive Social Media Outreach VA who lives inside DMs and inboxes—someone who thrives on building real relationships, not just sending copy-paste messages. You’ll be the daily engine behind our affiliate, ambassador, and UGC creator partnerships, handling every touchpoint from first outreach to ongoing relationship management.



This isn’t a “set it and forget it” role. You’ll outreach every single day, follow up relentlessly (but respectfully), manage conversations across multiple platforms, draft complimentary orders on the store, and keep every thread organized so nothing falls through the cracks.



DAILY RESPONSIBILITIES





Outreach & Prospecting

Identify and reach out to potential affiliates, brand ambassadors, and UGC creators daily via DM,
, and comments

Personalize every outreach message—no generic templates; each message should feel like a one-on-one conversation

Follow up on all pending conversations daily; no lead goes cold without at least 2–3 strategic touchpoints

Research creators and influencers that align with the brand’s aesthetic, audience, and values before reaching out



Affiliate & Ambassador Program Management

Onboard new affiliates and ambassadors: send welcome info, codes, links, and expectations

Track affiliate performance and flag top performers for deeper partnerships or increased commissions

Maintain an up-to-date database of all active affiliates and ambassadors with contact info, status, and notes

Re-engage inactive affiliates with fresh offers, product drops, or personalized check-ins



UGC Creator Relationship Management

Source and vet UGC creators who can produce authentic, on-brand content

Manage the full back-and-forth: negotiate deliverables, timelines, compensation (product or paid), and usage rights

Coordinate product shipments to creators by drafting complimentary orders on Shopify

Follow up on content delivery deadlines and request revisions when needed

Build genuine, long-term creator relationships—not transactional one-offs



Order Drafting & Store Coordination

Draft free/complimentary orders on Shopify for approved ambassadors, affiliates, and UGC creators

Ensure correct products, sizes, and shipping details before submitting each order

Keep a running log of all gifted orders with tracking numbers, recipient details, and purpose



Organization & Reporting

Maintain a clean, organized outreach tracker (Google Sheets, Notion, or Trello) updated daily

Tag every contact by status: Prospecting, Contacted, Negotiating, Onboarded, Active, Inactive

Provide a brief end-of-day or end-of-week summary: outreach numbers, responses, onboarded partners, and any blockers

Flag high-potential partnerships and escalate to the brand owner for approval



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS





Exceptional written communication—you can shift tone from professional to casual and everything in between

Experience managing DM-based outreach at scale (Instagram, TikTok,
) without losing the personal touch

Strong organizational skills: you can juggle 50+ conversations at once and nothing slips

Comfortable navigating Shopify (specifically drafting orders and managing product details)

Experience with affiliate/ambassador/influencer programs or UGC coordination

Familiar with project management tools (Notion, Trello, Asana, or Google Sheets)

Self-starter who doesn’t need to be reminded—you build your own daily task list and execute

Fluent in English with strong grammar and spelling



BONUS (NICE TO HAVE)





Experience in e-commerce, DTC brands, or beauty/fashion/lifestyle niches

Basic understanding of affiliate platforms (e.g., GoAffPro, Refersion, ShareASale)

Canva skills for quick creator briefs or welcome kits

Social media savvy—you understand what makes content perform and can identify high-potential creators quickly



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)





METRIC

TARGET

New outreach messages sent per day

15–30+

Follow-ups completed per day

All pending threads touched

New affiliates/ambassadors onboarded per week

3–5+

UGC creators in active pipeline

5–10 at any time

Complimentary orders drafted per week

As needed (same-day turnaround)

Outreach tracker updated

Daily, end of shift





WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN THIS ROLE





Our DMs and outreach never go quiet—there’s always 
ntum in the pipeline

Creators and affiliates feel genuinely valued, not just “managed”

Every partnership is tracked, followed up on, and moved forward with intention

Complimentary orders go out same-day with zero errors

The brand owner never has to ask “What’s the status?”—you’ve already reported it



HOW TO APPLY

Send a short message introducing yourself, your relevant experience, and a brief example of an outreach DM you’d send to a potential brand ambassador. Show us how you’d start the conversation.

title: Premium Community Onboarding Specialist
description:
TIMELESS JUMP CLUB

Premium Community

Onboarding Specialist





Position Type:

Virtual Assistant — Contract / Part-Time to Full-Time

Schedule:

Monday–Friday (Flexible Hours with Call Availability)

Hours:

4–8 Hours/Day

Reports To:

Community Lead / Founder

Tools:

Loom, Zoom/Google Meet, Slack/
, Notion, Google Sheets





THE MISSION





Every new member who joins the Timeless Jump Club should feel like they just walked into a room where someone was already expecting them—welcomed, guided, and set up to win from Day 1.



We’re hiring a Premium Onboarding Specialist—someone who genuinely cares about people, is camera-comfortable, and gets energy from helping others navigate something new. You’ll be the first real human touchpoint for every person who enters our community, and your job is to make that first impression unforgettable.



This role is part guide, part host, part coach. You’ll jump on welcome calls, record personalized Loom walkthroughs, answer questions with patience and warmth, and make sure no new member feels lost, confused, or forgotten.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES





Welcome Calls & Live Onboarding

Hop on a personal welcome call with every new member within 24–48 hours of joining

Walk them through the community layout, resources, key milestones, and what to do first

Set expectations: what the Timeless Jump Club offers, how to get the most out of it, and who to reach out to

Make every call feel warm, personal, and unhurried—this is a premium experience, not a speed-run



Loom & Video Walkthroughs

Record clear, personalized Loom videos to guide members through specific features, modules, or next steps

Create reusable onboarding video templates for common questions and walkthroughs

Be presentable, well-spoken, and energetic on camera—you’re the face of their first experience

Update video resources as the community evolves, keeping everything current and polished



New Member Nurture & Follow-Up

Check in with every new member at Day 1, Day 3, Day 7, and Day 14 to ensure they’re engaged and progressing

Identify members who are going quiet early and proactively reach out before they disengage

Answer onboarding questions via DM, voice note, or quick Loom—whatever feels most personal

Celebrate small wins: first post, first module completed, first community interaction—make them feel seen



Community Guidance & Navigation

Serve as the go-to person new members can reach out to with any question in their first 30 days

Direct members to the right channels, resources, calls, or people based on their goals

Surface recurring confusion or friction points and relay them to the team so the experience keeps improving

Represent the Timeless Jump Club values in every interaction: warmth, excellence, and genuine care



Organization & Tracking

Maintain a clean onboarding tracker: every new member’s status, call dates, follow-up schedule, and notes

Tag members by stage: Welcomed, Call Scheduled, Call Completed, Day 7 Check-In, Fully Onboarded

Provide weekly reports: new members onboarded, engagement rates, common questions, and any at-risk members

Keep all Loom links, templates, and resources organized in a shared workspace (Notion or Google Drive)



WHO YOU ARE





A people-first person—you genuinely light up when you help someone feel welcome and confident

Camera-comfortable and well-spoken: you can record a Loom or jump on a Zoom and come across as warm, clear, and professional

Extremely organized—you can track 20+ new members at different stages without anything falling through the cracks

Proactive communicator—you don’t wait to be asked, you reach out before the silence becomes a problem

Patient and empathetic—you understand that people join at different skill levels and need different levels of hand-holding

Strong written and verbal English with excellent grammar

Comfortable using Loom, Zoom, Google Meet, and community platforms (Skool, 
, Slack, or similar)

Self-motivated: you build your own daily checklist and you execute without reminders



BONUS (NICE TO HAVE)





Experience onboarding members in a paid community, coaching program, or premiu
mbership

Background in customer success, community management, or client experience roles

Familiar with Skool, Circle, Kajabi, or similar community platforms

Basic design skills (Canva) for creating welcome graphics or onboarding guides

Experience in e-commerce, personal branding, or online education spaces



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)





METRIC

TARGET

Welcome call completed within

24–48 hours of joining

Personalized Loom sent per new member

Within first 24 hours

Day 3 / Day 7 / Day 14 check-ins

100% completion rate

New member engagement after 14 days

80%+ active in community

At-risk members flagged proactively

Before they go silent 7+ days

Onboarding tracker updated

Daily, end of shift

Weekly onboarding report submitted

Every Friday





WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE





Every new member feels like a VIP from the 
nt they walk in—not a number on a spreadsheet

No one is left wondering “What do I do now?”—you’ve already guided them to the next step

Retention stays high because members feel genuinely cared for during their most vulnerable window (the first 14 days)

The founder never has to chase onboarding status—your tracker and reports speak for themselves

The Timeless Jump Club becomes known as a community where people feel welcomed like family



HOW TO APPLY

Record a short 60-second Loom introducing yourself as if you were welcoming a brand-new member into the Timeless Jump Club. Show us your energy, your warmth, and how you’d make someone feel at home. Then send it along with a brief note about your relevant experience.

title: Data Analyst
description:

title: Real Estate Sales Closer Wanted! – $5 - $7 per hr + 3% Commission
description:

About the Opportunity:

We’re looking for a high-performing virtual acquisitions specialist to help us close off-market real estate deals. This is a sales-focused role — you’ll be speaking directly with motivated homeowners in the U.S., building rapport, negotiating offers, and helping lock up purchase contracts.



If you’ve worked in real estate cold calling, inbound seller qualification, or direct sales (especially in real estate wholesaling, solar, or insurance), you’ll love this opportunity.



No cold calling or cold texted needed! We’ll provide warm leads, full training, and systems. You bring the closing skills, confidence, and hunger to win.



What You’ll Do:

- Call warm leads daily, text leads daily, and consistently following up.

- Build rapport quickly and uncover motivation, timeline, and asking price.

- Follow up with sellers via phone calls and texting.

- Make offers, negotiate price and terms, etc.

- Book appointments, submit contracts, and get contracts signed.

- Update lead statuses and detailed notes in CRM (GoHighLevel)



You’re a Good Fit If You:

- Have 2+ years of real estate cold calling, inbound sales, or acquisitions experience

- Speak excellent English with a confident, friendly tone, and no Filipino accent.

- Know how to handle objections like “What’s your offer?” or “I need more time”, etc.

- Are confident working with KPIs, performance targets, and being held accountable.

- Are extremely reliable and consistent with your hours and CRM updates

- Can work U.S. hours (Eastern Standard Time) — ideally during the afternoons and evenings



Are comfortable using tools like:

- GoHighLevel or Podio/REI Reply/CRM equivalents

- Ring Central

- Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, google meet)



Compensation:

- Hourly rate: $5–$7/hour based on experience. If you have experience in Real Estate Wholesaling Acquisitions we can pay you $7 per hour!

- Performance bonus: 3% of total profits per closed deal you helped bring in. This means we can pay $100 - $750 per closed deal depending on the profit margin.

- Join a fast-growing real estate wholesaling business



Monthly KPI reviews and potential raise based on performance!



If you’re looking for a flexible, rewarding opportunity to grow with a company that values your work, apply now! Let’s close some deals together!



How to Apply (Follow These Instructions Exactly):

-
 your resume and a short paragraph about your sales experience and why you’re interested in this role to: BuyingINDY at Gmail



- Use the subject line:

Acquisitions VA Application – [Your Name]

title: Editor — Short-Form Process Films (YouTube)
description:
Overview



We’re looking for an editor to shape ~15-minute YouTube films documenting hands-on building and craft processes.



The footage has already been reduced by an associate editor (dead time removed, repetition minimized). This role is about true editorial shaping: structure, pacing, rhythm, and deciding what moments deserve attention.





Editorial inspiration blends:



- Calm, observational storytelling (similar to Martijn Doolaard, but shorter and more concise)



- Selective fast, compressed sequences that move quickly through repetitive labor when appropriate



- This is not a social-media template role and not an assistant editor position. You will be doing the actual cut.





What You’ll Be Editing



- Observational process footage (building, assembly, craft)



- A reduced rough cut prepared by an associate editor





The material still needs:



- Structure



- Pacing



- Editorial judgment



- Modulation between stillness and momentum





Responsibilities



- Shape the final ~15-minute edit from a reduced rough cut



- Decide when to slow down and let moments breathe



- Decide when to speed up and compress repetitive actions



- Maintain clarity of process without becoming instructional or verbose



- Iterate collaboratively based on feedback



- Deliver clean, reviewable cuts with clear communication





Editorial Style & Judgment



The ideal edit:



- Feels intentional and restrained, not flashy



- Holds attention without gimmicks



- Balances calm observation with moments of kinetic energy



- Compresses time where repetition exists



- Preserves atmosphere and texture



We’re looking for an editor who can move comfortably between quiet and fast—sometimes within the same sequence.





Time Expectations



- Footage is already reduced, so each episode typically requires fewer total hours than a full raw-footage edit



- Emphasis is on quality and decisiveness, not grinding through hours of material



- We value quick turnaround and attentiveness, not speed for speed’s sake





Compensation



- $10 to 15/hour, depending on experience and fit



- Paid hourly or per-block, with clear review checkpoints



- Long-term collaboration preferred if the fit is strong





Ideal Background



- Experience editing documentary, process, or observational footage



- Comfortable shaping structure and pacing from imperfect material



- Able to articulate why a moment works—or doesn’t



- Comfortable owning editorial decisions and iterating with feedback



- Strong attention to detail and communication





This Role Is Not



An assistant editor position



- A TikTok or short-form template job



- A marketing or ad-style edit



- A handoff-and-disappear freelance gig





How We Work



You’ll be trusted to edit independently, with direction and feedback provided along the way. We’re looking for someone who enjoys the responsibility of shaping meaning from process—not just executing instructions.





Next steps:



If this description feels like a good fit, the next step is a short conversation, followed by a small, paid working session to confirm editorial fit.

title: Full-Stack Developer - Part-Time to Full-Time (React / Expo / Node)
description:
Full-Stack Developer (React / Expo / Node)

US-Based Creative Agency | Remote



We’re a US-based creative agency looking for a reliable, product-minded full-stack developer to support a growing roster of client projects. We build custom web and mobile applications—not themes, templates, or page-builder sites.



You’ll primarily work on React and Expo frontends with Node.js + Firebase backends, integrating real-world services like Stripe, SendGrid, and third-party APIs.



This role starts part-time (20–25 hrs/week) and may transition to full-time after a trial period if it’s a strong fit on both sides.

What You’ll Do

- Build custom web and mobile applications using React and Expo (no page builders)

- Convert Figma designs into clean, mobile-first, production-ready code

- Implement backend logic using Node.js, Firebase (Auth, Firestore, Functions), and APIs

- Integrate services such as Stripe, SendGrid, authentication, and third-party platforms

- Write readable, maintainable code with attention to structure and performance

- Push work to GitHub and walk through progress via Loom when needed

- Work asynchronously using Notion, Slack, and lightweight task systems

- Occasionally assist with Shopify customizations (custom logic, not theme farms)



Required Skills

- Strong experience with React and modern JavaScript (ES6+)

- Experience building custom applications from scratch (not CMS theming)

- Solid HTML/CSS fundamentals (Tailwind preferred)

- Comfortable working with GitHub, pull requests, and code reviews

- Familiar with Figma handoff and translating designs into working UI

- Clear async communicator who can follow structured feedback and requirements



Bonus Skills

- Expo / React Native

- Node.js backend experience

- Firebase (Auth, Firestore, Functions)

- API integrations (Stripe, SendGrid, etc.)

- Experience using Cursor or AI-assisted IDEs

- Building admin dashboards or internal tools



Compensation

- Part-time (20–25 hrs/week): $750–$900 USD / month

- Full-time (after trial, if a great fit): $1,500–$1,800 USD / month

- Long-term role with increasing responsibility for the right person

- Full-time compensation is not guaranteed and depends on performance, reliability, and communication during the part-time trial period



How to Apply

Please include:

- A short intro about you and the type of projects you enjoy most

- Links to 2–3 recent projects (live URLs and/or GitHub repos)

- Your experience with React, Expo, Node/Firebase, and APIs

- Your availability and expected monthly rate (USD)



Start your application with:

“Clean Code Ready”

(Applications without this won’t be reviewed.)

title: CEO / Founder
description:
You'll be the CEO of a new business we build together, sharing profits 50-50 once we begin generating them. You'll be paid to learn everything needed on the job. This is a bit of an odd job posting. Allow me to explain.



I'm a highly paid AI researcher based in San Francisco. I have many business ideas relating to AI that could be quite successful, but I don't have the time to pursue them. My hope here is to find people I can supervise to try some of the ideas I don't have time for. I'm fine with people who are inexperienced but smart and hungry to learn. I can direct learning quite effectively, I think. Several of my friends run multimillion dollar companies, I have a good grasp of what's necessary here and I don't see any reason why someone motivated can't learn, given time and quality direction. You'll be learning about AI, how money works, marketing, sales, etc. You'll handle the majority of execution with my mentorship.



Send me evidence of:

- Learning quickly

- Work ethic. Character. Honesty.

- The ability to execute towards a goal by yourself, not only doing what you're told. Creativity.



Looking for several people to do this as their main focus, I can bump the number of hours if needed. Note that I'm looking for people I can work with long-term. The real gains will start to show up after 3 months of intensive learning.



I've kept the salary near the low end at $3/hr as a nudge towards people who value learning and believe in their own success. The real money will start once the business gets off the ground.

This is a founder-led role. You will work from clear guidelines, templates, and escalation rules.



Core Responsibilities

s, DMs, and social media comments during North American (ET) hours

s using templates

title: Graphic Designer (Amazon Focused)
description:
Who are we?

Rael is an award-winning, VC-backed clean feminine care and skincare startup with a mission to empower women to make safe, healthy choices for their bodies. Unlike conventional products, Rael products are toxin-free, chlorine-free, fragrance-free, and hypoallergenic—without ever compromising on quality, comfort, or performance.



Founded in 2017 in Southern California by three Korean American women with distinct backgrounds—a journalist and bestselling author, a former Disney movie distributor with a Harvard MBA, and an architect-turned-art director—Rael began with organic cotton cover pads and quickly became the #1 pad brand on Amazon. Today, we’ve expanded into clean feminine care, feminine wellness supplements, and skincare inspired by K-beauty innovation, including pimple patches, facial sheet masks, and everyday skincare essentials. We’re also proud to be the #2 pimple patch brand on Amazon.



Rael products are sold at Amazon, 
, Target, Ulta Beauty, Walmart, CVS, Walgreens, Sprouts, and more. Our brand has been recognized across the industry, earning honors such as Wellness Brand of the Year (Glossy), Best Use of TikTok (Glossy), and multiple best-in-class beauty awards from Allure, Cosmopolitan, and Good Housekeeping, among others. Our CEO has also been recognized as an Entrepreneur of the Year by EY, reflecting Rael’s strong leadership and continued growth.



Rael was named to the Inc. 5000 list in both 2023 and 2024, celebrating the fastest-growing private companies in America, and has grown into a globally recognized brand with a branch office in Seoul, Korea. We’re also proud to be the most-followed and fastest-growing feminine care brand on TikTok, and a top women’s wellness brand trusted and loved by thousands of beauty and wellness influencers.



If you’re passionate about making a meaningful impact, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and want to help shape the future of women’s health and wellness, we’d love for you to join us.



Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate and diligent Graphic Designer to join our creative team at Rael, reporting to the Creative Director. The person for this role possesses the ability to work hands-on, conceptually as well as practically. You will work closely with our Senior Graphic Designer and Creative Director on digital projects, focused on executing graphic design for our Amazon business. Projects include copy and image updates, and design for
, ads, social, and website work, with a special focus on mobile design. The right candidate will have an insatiable appetite to create and develop content across a wide variety of platforms and mediums, collaborate with the team, and uphold the quality, and  look and feel Rael’s visual storytelling. 



Most importantly, we hope you share our enthusiasm for our products and the mission that drives us. If you are passionate about what we do and eager to contribute to our cause, we would love to hear from you!



What you will do:

- As a dedicated Amazon designer, focus on Amazon projects such as:

     - Product main and listing image updates 

     - Regulatory updates

     - Image asset updates for various language translations

     - Amazon promotional banner and newsletter assets i.e. Prime Day

     - Storefront, A+ content, and homepage banner refresh updates

     - Virtual bundle images

     - Wireframing to develop consistent visual systems, templates and guidelines 

     - Photo retouching/compositing: realistic product replacement/recomposition  of assortments within existing photography

     - Postcard design

     - Packaging updates

- Support the rest of the Rael business beyond Amazon by executing designs for various digital applications, including listing images,
, ads, website, social media, renderings, product training templates, and promotional collaterals in partnership with marketing and sales

- Ensure that all artworks meet all brief requirements, including correct dimensions, resolution, format, and die-lines

- Follow provided creative direction within existing assets and uphold consistent, high quality, on brand look and feel

- BONUS: Proficiency in packaging design layout and software to make copy changes and export files

- BONUS: Video editing skills, ability to cut and edit existing videos into new versions, dimensions, or formats



What will make you stand out:



Experience

- 3+ years of graphic design experience, in digital and e-commerce; in-house and/or agency

- Ability to work quickly, efficiently, and accurately within all required aspects of the Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator (BONUS: After Effects, Premiere Pro)

- Obsessed with design principles, precision and holds all work to a high standard

- Dedicated to finding creative solutions to design problems, always considering new visual ways to effectively communicate messages across platforms and channels



Interpersonal

- You take pride in producing accurate, high-quality work and catching the small things that make a big difference

- Comfortable communicating clearly and effectively with tea
mbers at all levels, whether it’s through
, reports, or face-to-face conversations

- You’re skilled at staying organized, meeting deadlines, and getting things done independently without much handholding

- Always ready to pitch in and go the extra mile to support your teammates and help the team succeed



Additional Preferred Experience and Skills

- Expertise in Amazon image strategy and familiar with A/B testing tools such as Amazon Seller Central



Please note this is a full time, contract position meaning you will be paid for the hours worked. We do not offer paid holidays or health benefits. Paid sick or vacation time off will be available to you after 6 months of employment.

title: 100k-150k Are You A PH CPA? WFH US Senior Accountant Position +HMO + 13TH
description:
Get ready, we’re poised to take over the world of accounting –well, almost. Come join our small and agile team as we continue steady growth while having fun in the process. We’re on the move in this fast paced ever changing market as new technology is being birthed at a rapid rate -you adapt or die!



You would be responsible for managing client accounts including direct contact with the clients and their CPAs, reviewing their files for accuracy and completeness before submitting reports. You will also be working directly with client managers and making sure work is completed for them on time and relaying any needs to them if items are needed from clients. Relationship with our clients is paramount so a pleasant friendly personality is a definite asset. You must possess excellent interpersonal skills, value attention to detail, can handle a variety of responsibilities simultaneously, ability to work independently, problem solve and act with foresight.



Our team of accountants is a very hard-working group and anyone who joins the team will be expected to pull their weight. During tax season, our team is expected to be available up to 60 hours per week with overtime pay over 40 hrs per week. However, this is usually only 8-10 times per year. Outside of the busy season, our team works standard 40-hour weeks.



Who We Are:



We exist to help business owners take their attention off their bookkeeping & accounting and focus on running their business! As nerdy as it may sound, we love accounting. The satisfaction that comes from balancing a reconciliation is, well, rewarding to say the least! We have helped many of our clients increase profits and have a better understanding of how to thrive in their field as a result of working closely with them.



We enjoy working as a team and building lasting relationships within our company! We focus on work/life integration and always learning and growing, personally and professionally.



Some of our values include:



Honesty and Trustworthiness

Can do/Get it done attitude

High value for self & others

Team player

Open communication

Positive outlook on life and work

Growing and learning individually & professionally



Who We Work With:



We work with small to medium size businesses in over 20 industries.



Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To:



-Reconciling payroll, cash accounts & balance sheet and maintain supporting documentation (full cycle bookkeeping & accounting)

-Calculate, prepare and file sales tax returns

-Preparing 1099s, send to recipients and clients, e-file with IRS and state agencies

-Payroll - including on-boarding new payroll clients, registering with government agencies, processing payroll and calculating/preparing payroll reports and quarterly returns

-Perform intercompany reconciliations

-Assist with 3rd party financial audits

-Review and prepare journal entries relating to fixed assets, inventory, accruals & deferrals

-Commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality while working with client data.

-Willingness to consistently and accurately follow established policies and procedures.

-Perform ad-hoc analysis, research and reports as needed

-Communicate with client CPAs regarding client file and managing necessary communication at tax time

-Work on client files using US GAAP, modified cash basis or cash basis

-Completing work for 5-8 clients files per day on a regular basis and meeting associated deadlines

-On average 40% of work is client contact (including last minute requests)/managing expectations, the other 60% is working in and reviewing files

-Ability to work by yourself a majority of your day and prioritize tasks

-Must have high value for organizing and meeting deadlines and handling multiple projects simultaneously

-Must be adaptable and willing to change with new processes & procedures as we grow

-Must have excellent work habits, including dependability and willingness to work the hours necessary to meet deadlines during seasonal increases in workload

-Assist with the implementation of a new accounting systems & learning new software for clients

-Create and maintain process documentation for each client

-People skills and working with a wide range of client personalities

-Ability to communicate financials and general accounting concepts clearly and effectively to clients

-Solve problems and develop new methods of analysis, identify, and implement process improvements

-Teach other tea
mbers & clients with patience and respect

-Embrace coaching and feedback given to you and implement changes as needed to help meet team and client goals.

-Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence

-24-hour communication. Deal with the
 or phone call request on the same day or advise the client or tea
mber -when you will get back to them.

-If you have informed the client or tea
mber that you will get back to them by day X, ensure that you have done that by the promised date.

-If unable to meet the original target, discuss a new (realistic) deadline with the tea
mber/client that suits their needs.



Qualifications:



Success in this role is partly determined by:

Accuracy of your work

Ability to meet deadlines and work on important as well as urgent tasks

Positive & enthusiastic attitude – solutions focused

Internal Responsiveness to
s & Phone Calls

Cooperation with Tea
mbers

Quality of working papers

Reliability – on time to work and meetings

Following Procedures and systems





Must have as a minimum of:

Be able to start working within 1 month upon acceptance of job offer

You have meticulous attention to detail with the superb organizational skills

Excellent written & spoken English

Experience working nights

Experience working with US clients: 1 year (Preferred)

2 years of full cycle US accounting or related experience (Preferred)

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance

Must have experience with MS Excel (pivot tables and advanced formulas etc.)

Strong understanding and implementation of GAAP

A quiet and clean place to work and conduct Zoo
etings from, away from distractions

Stable internet connection of at least 5Mbps and a backup of a pocket WiFi or Mobile Data

History of promotion in a similar role

working night shift: 1 year (Preferred)



Mandatory:

You are a genuinely good-hearted person who is FRIENDLY and fun to work with! You enjoy being part of a cohesive team of “drama-free” professionals who are responsible, show up to work regularly and on time, and you take full responsibility for your work. You don’t make excuses, and you own up to your mistakes and realize that all mistakes are learning opportunities that allow you to improve yourself. NO OUTSIDE CLIENTS.



Nice to have:

Strong in QuickBooks Online and QuickBooks Desktop

US Tax experience and/or CPA license is a plus

Experience working for The Big Four accounting firms





Job Type:

Full-Time

Direct Hire

Long Term Position

Hourly Pay Guaranteed 40 Hrs Per Week

Overtime Pay 1.5 X Rate Over 40 Hrs Per Week

Pay Includes Night Shift Differential



Benefits Include:

15 Days Paid Leave Per Year

HMO Plan For You

Reimbursement for OFS PhilHealth

SSS Self Payments

Opportunities For Promotion

Pay Raises

Work From Home

Paid Training

High-end IT devices



Schedule:

8 hour night shift

Mon-Fri 8:00AM - 5:00 PM PST

(Your schedule would follow the 1 hour “Daylight Savings” time change PST)





Resume Submission Instructions:



Earn bonus points and show us your attention to details when sending us your resume. Copy and paste the following address into a new browser and upload your resume:




/u/v65h7mo3n4xh3nus32dhi8





Please name the file using the following format: Last name, First Name, "Resume", Date.





Required: Show off your spoken English skills and record a quick (at least 2 mins) video of yourself telling us why you love accounting and working with clients! Go ahead and upload it along with your resume and please name the files using the format listed above.



*We appreciate all applications, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer. Hiring decisions are administered without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.



Do you sponsor Visas/require relocation?

We do not offer sponsor visas. We’ll hire great people anywhere across the Philippines, no relocation is required.

title: Real Estate Video Editor (Project-Based, Long-Term Opportunity)
description:
URGENT HIRING – REAL ESTATE VIDEO EDITOR



We are looking for a skilled Real Estate Video Editor to work with us on a project-based basis, with the opportunity to move into a monthly retainer or full-time role as volume grows.



This role is execution-focused. You will be editing real estate walkthrough and promotional property videos using clear references, instructions, and feedback.



About Us:

22Vision is an Australian-founded creative studio working with real estate brands, agencies, and businesses across Australia. We focus on clean, modern, high-performing video content with strong systems, fast turnaround times, and clear communication.



What You’ll Be Doing:

- Editing real estate walkthrough and property promotion videos

- Clean cuts, pacing, stabilisation, and light speed ramps

- Basic colour correction and consistency across clips

- Music syncing and professional flow

- Following references and feedback precisely

Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- Proven experience editing real estate videos

- Portfolio with real estate editing samples

Nice to Have:

- Familiarity with Australian / Western real estate styles

Pay & Structure:

- Project-based at the start (paid per video)

- Opportunity for monthly retainer or full-time role later

- Competitive pay based on experience and performance



IMPORTANT:

To apply, include the word “VISION” in your first message and send 2–3 real estate video samples.

Applications without real estate samples will not be considered.

title: Staffing Representative
description:
Job description:



Job Title: Staffing Representative - Home Health Therapy (Remote, Night Shift)



Location: Work from Home - (U.S. Pacific Standard Time)



About the Company

A List Therapy Group is a California-based provider of in-home physical, occupational, and speech therapy services. We partner with over 300 agencies and hospitals, delivering exceptional patient care through our large network of licensed therapists.



Position Overview

We are hiring a full-time Staffing Representative to work remotely. This role coordinates therapist assignments, manages incoming referrals, updates patient records, and ensures fast, accurate communication with both clinicians and U.S.-based partner agencies. You will also be responsible for problem-solving staffing challenges and maintaining strong professional relationships with our therapists.



Key Duties



• Review and respond to incoming patient referrals in real time.

• Assign therapists based on location, coverage area, and specialty.

• Enter and update patient data in CliniConnects and TherapySync.

• Follow up on pending cases and manage restaffing when needed.

• Send consent forms and required documents to therapists.

• Communicate promptly via WhatsApp, phone, and
.

• Maintain positive working relationships with therapists to encourage engagement and reliability.

• Identify and resolve staffing issues quickly to prevent delays in patient care.

• Maintain accurate records and update rate sheets as needed.



Qualifications



• Experience in home health staffing, healthcare scheduling, or medical coordination preferred.

• Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).

• Proven problem-solving abilities and conflict resolution skills.

• Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with therapists.

• Highly organized, able to multitask, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Proficiency with Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and data entry systems.

• Own computer, noise-cancelling headset, and stable internet connection.

• Comfortable using Hubstaff and 
 with a working camera.

• Willing to work night shift: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM PST (Philippines time: 12:00 AM–9:00 AM).



Why Join Us



• Competitive pay for remote work.

• Work directly with a U.S.-based healthcare company.

• Supportive, team-focused environment with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



• Please send a short cover letter highlighting your experience relevant to the role you are applying for, and include your answers to the questions below:

     1. How many years of experience do you have working for a home health provider company?

     2. How many years of experience do you have working as a staffing coordinator?



Once received, we will send you a link to a form that you will need to complete.



Applicants who do not fill out this form we send you will NOT be considered for this position!





Thanks

A List Therapy Group

title: Facebook Ads Graphic Designer
description:
fast-growing e-commerce brand scaling through systematic Meta advertising. We need a designer who understands direct response marketing, not just pretty graphics.



What You'll Do:



Create high-volume static ad iterations based on winning competitor concepts

Design scroll-stopping
/Instagram ads that drive sales, not likes

Rapidly test multiple variations of winning angles

Work within our Ferrari Framework creative testing system



Required Skills:



Figma (primary design tool)

Canva (for quick iterations)

Photoshop (image editing)

Claude AI (for copy assistance/workflow)

Portfolio showing direct response ads (not brand/lifestyle work)



Must Have:



Experience analyzing and iterating on competitor static ads

Understanding of direct response principles (hooks, benefits, urgency)

Ability to produce 20-50+ ad variations per week

Fast turnaround time - we test aggressively



You're NOT a Fit If:



You focus on "pretty" over performance

You need hand-holding on every concept

You can't analyze what makes competitor ads work

You take 2+ days per static ad



To Apply:



Share your portfolio (direct response ads ONLY)

Show 3 examples of competitor ad iterations you've created

Explain what makes a static ad scroll-stopping in 2-3 sentences



Looking for someone who moves fast, tests systematically, and understands that ugly ads often outperform beautiful ones.

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:

IMPORTANT: We are ONLY looking for serious, committed individuals who are ready to work hard and grow with us. If you are not 100% dedicated to delivering quality work every day, this job is NOT for you.

title: EA & Social Media Manager Real Estate Accounting Firm
description:

Location & Schedule

• Full-time, 40 hours/week

• Must be able to overlap with US Central Time (at least 6–8 hours per day for meetings,

inbox, and community moderation)



Role Overview

You will be the CEO’s right hand, combining executive assistant support with social media and

community management. You’ll manage daily content, communication, and calendars across

multiple businesses while using AI tools to repurpose content and increase engagement.



Key Responsibilities



Social Media Management

, Instagram,

LinkedIn; YouTube/shorts or TikTok as needed)

members, welcome new members, and respond to basic questions

etings, coaching calls, and webinars

s, and uploading replays

s on behalf of the CEO using agreed rules,

mbers, clients, and partners as needed (e.g., sending

, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube/shorts, OpusClip, CapCut,

s, and community replies

environment

 marketing sequences

 with the subject line:

title: Virtual Clinical Operations Assistant (RN/BSN Preferred) Psychiatry & Mental Health Practice – U.S.-Based
description:
About the Practice:

Casey Mental Health Collaborative is a growing, physician-led outpatient psychiatry practice providing medication management and therapy services across North Carolina. We prioritize high clinical standards, patient-centered care, and efficient, ethical systems.



We are seeking a highly organized Virtual Clinical Operations Assistant to support medication refills, prior authorizations, and medical records workflows. This role is ideal for a nurse or nursing graduate who enjoys structured clinical-administrative work and wants a long-term virtual position with a U.S. mental health practice.



Position Overview:

This is a remote, full-time virtual role combining responsibilities traditionally handled by:



-Medication refill coordination

-Prior authorization processing

-Medical records management



The role does not involve independent clinical decision-making or patient diagnosis, but does require strong clinical judgment, attention to detail, and comfort working within psychiatric workflows under provider direction and communication with patients and pharmacies for clinical clarification.



Core Responsibilities for Medication Refill Management:

-Medication Refills & Pharmacy Coordination

-Process medication refill requests in Valant under provider protocols

-Communicate with pharmacies regarding prescriptions, refill timing, and clarifications

-Track refill status and escalate urgent or complex issues appropriately

-Coordinate patient refill requests and documentation

-Prior Authorizations

-Prepare and submit prior authorizations for psychiatric medications

-Gather clinical documentation required by insurers

-Track authorization status and follow up proactively

-Communicate outcomes to providers and internal staff



Core Responsibilities for Medical Records & Documentation:

-Process medical records requests within required timelines

-Prepare HIPAA-compliant patient summaries for therapy and external provider requests

-Coordinate disability paperwork and insurance audit requests

-Manage faxed records and secure document handling



Core responsibilities for Administrative & Compliance Support:

-Ensure HIPAA compliance in all communications

-Maintain accurate documentation in Valant

-Follow established SOPs for escalation to providers

-Communicate clearly with U.S.-based clinical and administrative teams



Required Qualifications:

- Nursing degree (RN, BSN, or equivalent international nursing degree strongly preferred)

- Experience in a clinical, hospital, or outpatient healthcare setting

- Familiarity with medical terminology and prescription workflows

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills (okay to use AI such as Krisp for accent reduction)

- High attention to detail and ability to follow protocols precisely

- Reliable high-speed internet and private work environment



Strongly Preferred:

-Experience with U.S. healthcare systems

-Prior work with EHR systems (Valant experience is a plus, not required)

-Experience handling prior authorizations or pharmacy coordination

-Background in psychiatry, behavioral health, or primary care



What This Role Is / Is Not

This role is:

-Structured, protocol-driven, and clinically adjacent - TEAM COMMUNICATION IS REQUIRED...AND FUN/AWESOME

-Focused on operational excellence and patient safety

-Long-term and integral to the practice



This role is not:

Independent nursing practice

Clinical decision-making or patient assessment

A short-term or task-based VA role



Schedule & Compensation:

-Full-time, remote (Philippines-based)

-Work hours aligned with U.S. Eastern Time (specific hours to be discussed AND somewhat flexible)

-Competitive compensation based on experience and credentials

-Paid training and clear onboarding process



How to Apply

Please submit:

-Resume or CV

-Brief cover letter explaining your clinical background and interest in virtual psychiatric practice

-Confirmation of nursing degree and year completed

- Please submit your identifying documents to onlinejobs.ph for ID score increase

title: Research-Based Virtual Assistant – Contractor Resources & Bid Research
description:
About Us

We are a growing U.S.-based insurance agency that works closely with contractors across multiple trades, helping them protect and grow their businesses. In addition to insurance, we are building a contractor-focused website designed to make running a construction business easier — from finding bid opportunities to choosing the right software, tools, and services.

We’ve been employing Virtual Assistants in the Philippines for over 8 years and currently work with a team of 20+ VAs. We value long-term relationships, clear systems, and work that actually makes a difference. Our goal is to build useful, practical resources contractors can trust — and we’re looking for the right person to help us do that.

?

Overview

We are looking for a detail-oriented, research-driven Virtual Assistant who can independently find bid opportunities, software tools, and business resources used by contractors — then clearly document and present those findings in a contractor-friendly way.

This role is not data entry. It requires curiosity, critical thinking, and the ability to explain things simply. If you enjoy researching, comparing options, and turning complex information into clear guidance, this role is a great fit.

?

Responsibilities

???? Research & Data Collection

• Find public and private bid opportunities for contractors, including:

• Local, state, and federal bids

• Commercial and private bid platforms

• Research construction-related software and services, including:

• Estimating and takeoff software

• Project management tools

• Accounting and payroll platforms

• CRM systems

• Scheduling tools

• Safety and compliance tools

• Identify industry-specific resources such as:

• Grants

• Associations

• Certifications

• Training programs

• Supplier and vendor tools

?

???? Resource Evaluation

For each tool or resource, determine and document:

• What the tool or resource does

• Price ranges or typical pricing tiers (when exact pricing is unavailable)

• Pros and cons specifically for contractors

• What type of contractor it’s best suited for, based on:

• Trade

• Company size

• Residential vs commercial focus

• Revenue stage

• Clearly flag:

• Entry-level vs advanced tools

• Best options for solo operators vs growing companies

?

?? Content Creation

• Write clear, polished descriptions for publication on our website

• Translate technical or confusing features into plain English contractors understand

• Organize content consistently so contractors can quickly answer:

• “Is this for me?”

• “Is this worth the cost?”

?

???? Organization & Documentation

• Log all findings in shared documents or project management tools

• Maintain clean, structured records so information is easy to update

• Follow standardized templates and formatting guidelines

?

Required Skills & Qualifications

• Strong online research skills — you know how to dig, compare, and verify

• Excellent written English (clarity matters more than fancy language)

• Ability to summarize complex information simply

• High attention to detail

• Comfortable working independently without constant supervision

• Basic understanding of:

• Construction businesses or

• Small business operations

(You do not need to be a contractor, but you must be willing to learn how they think.)

?

Preferred (Nice to Have)

• Experience researching SaaS tools or business software

title: AI GIRL | Viral Social Media Video Copy/Creation
description:
YOU MUST READ THE WHOLE JOB AND COMPLETE TASK CORRECTLY FOR ME TO REPLY



Job Description — AI Viral Reel Copy / Generation (Part-Time)



I’m hiring a highly switched-on Virtual Assistant to help grow and scale AI-based social media accounts (AI girls) into real audiences and profitable private platforms.



This role is not basic editing and not casual work.



Your job is to understand why short-form content goes viral, translate those patterns into AI-generated reels using photos, and write copy that maximizes retention and conversions.



You’ll be working directly with me and my systems.



What you’ll be doing



Analyzing viral Instagram/TikTok reels to identify hooks, pacing, emotional triggers, and structure



Translating viral ideas into AI-ready shot concepts using still images



Writing scroll-stopping hooks, captions, and CTAs that fit a defined AI persona



Assisting with AI reel creation workflows (training and software provided)



Improving realism, retention, and believability of AI-generated content



Following a daily production schedule with consistency



What this role is (and is NOT)



This role IS:



Creative



Analytical



Pattern-based



Performance-driven



This role is NOT:



Heavy manual video editing



Guesswork



Inconsistent or casual work



Requirements (read carefully)



Available 1–2 hours per day, 7 days a week MINIMUM

No missed days — consistency matters



Strong understanding of short-form viral content



Ability to think in beats, 
nts, and attention



Comfortable learning and working with AI tools



Clear written communication



Willing to be tested before hiring



???? REQUIRED APPLICATION FILTER (IMPORTANT)



If you do not follow this exactly, your application will be ignored.



Step 1 — Start your message EXACTLY like this:



Attention beats editing.



(Yes — exactly like that, including the full stop.)



Step 2 — Answer this (bullet points only):



What makes someone stop scrolling in the first 2 seconds of a reel?



Rules:



Write 3 bullet points only



Each bullet must be one sentence



Do not mention tools, apps, or software



Focus on psychology, emotion, or timing



Step 3 — End your message with this exact sentence:



I can commit to 1–2 hours per day, 7 days a week.



Performance & rewards



You will be rewarded for viral performance



More hours and responsibility unlock as you prove value



Missed days, low-quality work, or sloppy execution = hours deducted



High performers grow quickly in this role



How to apply



Complete the application filter above.

Only candidates who pass will receive the next skills tests.



If you’re disciplined, creative, and serious about building something that scales — apply.

title: Senior Bookkeeper (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About Everything Accounted For (EAF)

At Everything Accounted For (EAF), we provide specialized bookkeeping services to businesses across a wide range of industries. Our clients range from small owner-operated companies to multi-million-dollar organizations with over 200 employees.

Our role is to handle the day-to-day financial operations behind the scenes so business owners can focus on growth. We maintain accurate books, perform month-end closes, and provide clear, timely financial reporting that clients rely on to make decisions.

We currently support over 50 clients and continue to grow.



The Role

We are looking for a Senior Bookkeeper who can own client files from start to finish, not just perform tasks.

This role is best suited for someone who:

- Is highly detail-oriented but also understands the bigger financial picture

- Is comfortable working independently and making judgment calls

- Enjoys solving problems and figuring things out

- Has experience managing multiple clients or entities simultaneously

This is not an entry-level role. You should be confident handling full-cycle bookkeeping with minimal supervision and producing clean, accurate books that are ready for accountant review.



Key Responsibilities

Full-Cycle Bookkeeping & File Ownership

- Own the accuracy and completeness of assigned client files

- Manage A/P, A/R, invoicing, and reconciliations

- Maintain and review charts of accounts

- Investigate discrepancies and resolve issues independently

Month-End Close

- Perform and complete month-end close processes

- Reconcile bank, credit card, and loan accounts

- Review financial statements for accuracy and anomalies

- Ensure books are accurate and ready for review at all times

Financial Reporting

- Prepare Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and A/R Aging reports

- Maintain organized, audit-ready financial records

Payroll & Remittances

- Manage payroll entries and payroll runs

- Process payroll remittances, and WSBC where applicable

Process Improvement

- Identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements

- Help develop and refine internal systems and workflows

Team Collaboration

- Participate in tea
etings

- Stay available on Slack during working hours

- Support teammates and contribute to solutions



What We’re Looking For

Experience

- 5+ years of full-cycle bookkeeping experience

- Strong QuickBooks Online experience required

- Experience preparing books for year-end and working with accountants

- Experience managing multiple clients or companies simultaneously is strongly preferred

- Experience in a bookkeeping firm or multi-client environment is an asset

Technical Skills

- QuickBooks Online (required)

- Google Workspace, MS Office, Outlook, Dropbox

- Slack and Loom

- Experience with Stripe, PayPal, Sage, or Xero is a plus

Core Competencies

We are specifically looking for someone who demonstrates:

- Strong independent problem-solving ability

- Exceptional attention to detail

- Strong organizational and time management skills

- The ability to work efficiently without sacrificing accuracy

- Comfort switching between multiple files and priorities

- Reliability and accountability

- Professional judgment and discretion with confidential data

You should be comfortable:

- Investigating and resolving discrepancies without step-by-step instructions

- Learning unfamiliar processes or tools independently

- Asking thoughtful questions when necessary, but not relying on constant direction



Work Environment

- Fully remote position

- Up to 40 hours per week

- Core hours aligned with PST

- Collaborative team environment using Slack and video calls



Why Join EAF?

At EAF, we value:

- Problem-solving

- Accuracy and speed

- Initiative

- Continuous learning

- Always finding a better way to do things

Our team takes ownership, supports one another, and continuously improves how we work. You’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact and help businesses succeed.



How to Apply

Please include the word “EVERYTHING” in your subject line.

In your application, please also include:

1. A brief description of the most complex bookkeeping file you’ve managed

2. The number of clients or companies you handled at one time

3. An example of a bookkeeping issue you identified and resolved independently

Applications that do not include this information may not be reviewed.

s)
