title: Senior Digital Marketing and Growth Manager
description:
Remote role. Competitive pay. Real Impact. Are you our next Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager?



This is not an entry-level position.



About Us:

• OLIVIA Professional Solutions helps U.S. home care businesses scale through highly trained Filipino Virtual Assistants. We’re a fast-growing, mission-driven company founded by a Filipino-American healthcare entrepreneur.



Offer Begins at:

• $1,200 per month (USD/US Dollar)

• 40 hours per week

• Full-TIme



Start Date: 

• ASAP



Schedule:

• 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM EST (US Eastern Time)

• Monday to Friday

• Time tracked by Hubstaff



Location: 

• Remote | 100% Work From Home

• Philippines-Based Candidates Preferred



Role Overview:

• OLIVIA Professional Solutions is engaging a Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager to lead and scale the company’s digital growth strategy. This role owns the full marketing engine, from demand generation and recruitment marketing to brand expansion and conversion optimization.

• This is a long-term, independent contractor engagement under a deliverables-based agreement. The contractor is expected to operate with a high level of autonomy, strategic ownership, and accountability, independently planning, executing, and optimizing marketing initiatives aligned with company growth objectives.

• The Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager will report directly to the Director of Operations and collaborate closely with company leadership to ensure marketing outcomes support revenue growth, recruitment goals, and new business initiatives.



Core Responsibilities:

• Own and lead all digital marketing, growth, and lead generation efforts across channels, ensuring consistent and measurable results aligned with company growth goals.

• Develop, execute, and continuously optimize data-driven marketing strategies that generate qualified leads, sales meetings, and recruitment applications.

• Assess and improve all marketing assets, systems, funnels, and campaigns, identifying gaps and implementing actionable enhancements in branding, messaging, and conversion performance.

• Manage and optimize GoHighLevel CRM, including automations, pipelines, nurture campaigns, and reporting systems that support scalability and visibility.

• Plan, launch, manage, and optimize paid advertising campaigns across
, Google, and LinkedIn with clear accountability for performance and ROI.

• Plan and execute webinars and virtual events that drive lead generation, authority building, and partnership opportunities.

• Design and execute recruitment marketing and employer branding initiatives to attract and convert high-quality virtual assistants.

• Oversee and strengthen the company’s digital presence, including Google My Business and all relevant online platforms, ensuring brand consistency and visibility.

• Collaborate with leadership to design and roll out marketing initiatives supporting client acquisition, franchise partnerships, affiliate programs, and other growth initiatives.

• Provide strategic direction and oversight to the Digital Marketing Specialist and other marketing contractors, ensuring alignment with strategy, standards, and performance expectations.

• Support hands-on campaign execution as needed, particularly during pilot initiatives, transitions, or high-impact launches.

• Define, track, and report on key marketing KPIs through dashboards and performance reports, driving accountability, insights, and continuous optimization.

• Plan and execute strategic marketing campaigns aligned with CEO participation in U.S. conferences and industry events to maximize visibility, lead generation, and partnership opportunities.



Contractor Requirements:

• Minimum of 3 years of proven experience in digital marketing management, growth strategy, and lead generation.

• Demonstrated ability to deliver measurable results through strategic planning, execution, and optimization.

• Experience managing multi-channel marketing campaigns, including paid media, social platforms, CRM funnels,
, and automation.

• Strong working knowledge of analytics, marketing automation systems, and recruitment marketing strategies.

• Hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or comparable CRM and funnel platforms.

• Proven capability in planning and executing webinars or digital events for lead generation and authority building.

• Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

• Highly data-driven, proactive, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.

• Owns and maintains the tools, software, and systems required to perform the work as an independent contractor.

• Professional, self-directed, and accountable for outcomes, not just activity.



Ideal Qualities:

• We are looking for a self-motivated strategist who operates independently with minimal oversight.

• Can quickly evaluate what’s working and what’s not.

• Thinks creatively and critically to design campaigns that deliver tangible results.

• Can confidently discuss real-world marketing experience and results (not AI-generated plans).



Why Join Us?

• Start with a competitive salary.

• Work remotely with a fast-growing company.

• Be part of a mission-driven company helping both U.S. business owners and Filipino professionals thrive.

• Work alongside a visionary founder and a small but mighty and growing operations team. 



APPLY NOW by sending the following requirements:



1. Your updated Portfolio/Resume/CV



2. A brief 2-3 minute intro video recording sharing your experience and why we should work with you. This will help our team screen better. Please ensure that your video recording is accessible to view.



3. Send all application requirements through the link below and click APPLY NOW:

title: Accounting/Office Manager
description:
Accounting/Office Manager

Job Summary

Our busy, multi industry business includes Luxury Performance Automotive wheel manufacturing and Investment Real Estate needs a reliable, well-organized Accounting/Office Manager to handle day-to-day

operations with a focus on accounting efficiency and project management. Overseas, the AR/AP, and monthly financial reporting for the companies. The Accounting/Office Manager is responsible for

strategizing and coordinating firm operations that support our staff and client base.

We are looking for an energetic professional who doesn’t mind wearing multiple hats and is excited about

streamlining accounting/administrative procedures. The Accounting/Office Manager helps oversees the firm’s accounting, human resources, shipping, and administrative functions. The Accounting/Office Manager is a valued member of the firm’s management and interfaces with the partner group on a daily basis. A desire to have a long term commitment to grow the firm. **Will need to work US 10am to 7pm EST hours to assist with our CA team.



Responsibilities & Duties

Maintain positive office atmosphere through leadership and communication.

Interact and problem solve with partners, staff, clients, and prospects.

*Administration – Develop organizational procedures and systems for firm administration, including

maintaining records, document management (physical and electronic), office equipment, and supplies.

Act as a backup for our Audit Administrator as needed.

*Accounting – Work with our CPA to provide the information needed on a timely basis. Perform bookkeeping duties such as accounts payable and accounts receivable. Calling Customers or Tenants. Maintain time and billing system. Make sure expenses are all entered and knows how to export and manipulate information from the bank and credit cards and import them into QUICKBOOKS.

Human Resources – A small part of the business, but Work with our current and past employees on payroll questions, new

employee onboarding, recruiting support, and exit interviews. Act as human resources point person for

firm employees with resources. Maintain personnel files and employment records.

SHIPPING – Approve or create shipping labels as needed or request them from our customers as needed.

Marketing – responsible for Downloading, formatting, cleaning up and send inventory file bi weekly and send it to our customers. Pick up inbound calls when needed and help solve issues that our customer service team cannot. If needed Interface with our outsourced marketing firm to coordinate execution of key marketing.

initiatives.

Qualifications & Skills

Comfort with a fast-paced environment

Strong organizational skills, ability to juggle multiple tasks and priorities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Advanced computer skills, comfortable with new technology

5 or more years experience with accounting

Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, QuickBooks experience needed. Fishbowl Inventory experience a plus. Also US accounting experience a plus. 

Associate degree required (B.A. or B.S. preferred)

Good in excel manipulation and have some macro writing skills in excel required.

description:
Job Summary

This position is for a highly motivated and exceptionally organized Legal Assistant within a fast-paced legal environment. This hybrid role is essential to the success of our practice, providing a full range of support to attorneys in both pre-litigation and litigation phases.



The ideal candidate is a proactive problem-solver with strong technical skills and a client-focused attitude. You will be responsible for a blend of paralegal and legal assistant duties, managing case files from inception through resolution.



Core Responsibilities

Administrative & Client Support

• Answer and screen incoming phone calls, acting as a professional first point of contact for clients, opposing counsel, and courts.

• Handle, process, and distribute all incoming/outgoing faxes and mail.

• Serve as a key point of contact for clients, providing non-legal status updates and gathering necessary information.

• Perform conflict checks for all potential new matters.

• Open new client matters and maintain physical and electronic files in accordance with firm standards.



Case Management & Development

• Maintain and meticulously update the firm's case management software with deadlines, contact information, case status, and notes.

• Manage and maintain attorney calendars, including scheduling appointments, calls, and critical case deadlines.

• Draft and send letters of representation to clients, opposing counsel, insurance carriers, and healthcare providers.

• Obtain, track, and follow up on all case-related records, including medical bills/reports, employment records, police reports, and insurance information.

• Draft detailed medical summaries and chronologies.

• Acknowledge and track liens from providers, insurers, and government agencies (e.g., Medicare/Medicaid).

• Assist attorneys with the preparation and assembly of settlement demand packages.



Litigation & Discovery

• Assist with drafting initial pleadings, including Summons, Complaints, and Answers.

• Coordinate service of process for summonses, complaints, and subpoenas.

• Draft outgoing discovery, including Form Interrogatories, Special Interrogatories, Requests for Production of Documents, and Requests for Admission.

• Prepare "skeletons" for discovery responses, coordinate the collection of responsive documents and information from the client, and prepare final responses.

• Organize and Bates stamp document productions (both incoming and outgoing).

• Review and analyze discovery responses from other parties, identifying deficiencies and assisting with "meet and confer" correspondence.

• Prepare and issue deposition and records subpoenas.

• Schedule depositions, mediations, and hearings, including coordinating with all parties, court reporters, and videographers.

• Prepare and serve Notices of Deposition (NODs) and other hearing notices.

• Set up and manage remote appearances (e.g., via Zoom or court-specific portals).

Motion, Trial, & Case Resolution

• Assist with drafting notices of motion and declarations; prepare and organize motion exhibits.

• Assist with trial preparation, including the creation of exhibit binders, witness lists, and trial binders.

• Coordinate and communicate with expert witnesses to schedule, obtain reports, and prepare expert designations.

• Prepare, serve, and electronically file various legal documents in state and federal courts (e.g., OneLegal, File&Serve, CM/ECF).

• Negotiate lien reductions with medical providers and insurers.

• Prepare and file CMS-related documents and declarations.

• Draft settlement agreements, releases, and Requests for Dismissal.

• Prepare final distributions/disbursement schedules and corresponding check letters for clients and providers.

• Handle all file-closing procedures, including archiving documents and returning original materials to the client.



Qualifications & Skills

• Experience: 3+ years of experience as a legal assistant or paralegal in a civil litigation environment. Experience in personal injury legal assistant work in California is a plus. 

• Education: Paralegal Certificate or equivalent combination of education and experience is a plus.

Technical Skills:

o High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel).

o Experience with case management software (e.g., PracticePanther, Clio, MyCase, ProLaw, etc.).

o Proficiency with PDF software (e.g., Adobe Acrobat) for Bates stamping, redacting, and exhibits.

o Experience with state and federal e-filing portals is required.

Core Competencies:

o Exceptional organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail.

o Strong written and verbal communication skills.

o Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and work effectively under pressure.

o Proactive and resourceful, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

o Understands and maintains strict confidentiality.

title: AI Image Ad Creator (Simple, Repetitive Work – No Design Skills Needed)
description:
We are hiring someone to handle a simple, repeatable task using AI tools.



This is not a creative role and not a design-heavy role.

It is a process-based execution role where you will follow a clear SOP to generate curiosity-driven image ads using ChatGPT or Claude and an AI image generator.



These image ads do not mention a product or brand.

Their only purpose is to get attention and clicks.



You will not be writing copy, designing manually, or making creative decisions.



If you are comfortable with repetitive work, following instructions exactly, and working efficiently, this role will be easy.



What You Will Be Doing



Follow a step-by-step SOP exactly as provided

Use ChatGPT or Claude to generate image ad concepts

Turn those concepts into detailed AI image prompts

Paste prompts into an AI image generator

Download the generated images

Upload images into organized Google Drive folders



That’s it.



No meetings

No client communication

No revisions



Workload and Expectations



Approximately 50 image ads per day

Around 2 hours of work per day

This is a production role focused on volume and consistency

You are not responsible for d
 which ads are good — we handle selection



Requirements



Strong English comprehension (very important)

Ability to follow instructions exactly without improvising

Comfortable with repetitive copy-paste tasks

Familiar with Google Drive

Stable internet connection



Design or marketing experience is NOT required.



Tools You Will Use



ChatGPT or Claude

An AI image generator (we will specify)

Google Drive



Pay and Schedule



Long-term position for the right person

More hours may be available if performance is consistent



How to Apply (Required)



You MUST review the instructions at the link below and follow them exactly.

Proactively check in with tea
mbers, follow up after questions, and ensure work is completed accurately and on time

Use team group chats and project channels to keep everyone informed of issues, resolution steps, and outcomes for maximum transparency

etings (Zoom), delegate tasks, and hold the team accountable

title: URGENT HIRING!! Technical Support Representative (Deep Technical / IT Specialist)
description:
Are you a tech ninja who loves solving complex problems and diving deep into system issues? Do you enjoy helping users while tackling advanced troubleshooting challenges? If you’re passionate about IT, systems, and customer success — this is your chance to shine!



We’re looking for a Technical Support Representative (TSR) with strong technical expertise and a proactive, analytical mindset. This role involves providing deep-level support for hardware, software, and network-related issues across various systems and platforms.



Key Responsibilities:

*Provide technical support for hardware, software, and network issues.

*Diagnose and troubleshoot system errors, connectivity problems, and application malfunctions.

*Install, configure, and update operating systems, software, and devices.

*Ensure timely resolution of user-reported issues via phone, chat, or ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, Jira, ServiceNow).

*Configure and troubleshoot VPNs, DNS, BIOS settings, firewalls, and proxies.

*Maintain accurate documentation of technical problems and solutions for future reference.

*Collaborate with the IT team to implement preventive measures and reduce recurring issues.

*Manage user accounts, permissions, and access control across systems.

*Support cybersecurity best practices by monitoring systems and ensuring compliance with IT policies.

*Handle escalations and tier 2–3 level troubleshooting within defined SLA timelines.

*Track, analyze, and resolve technical issues using a structured ticketing workflow.

*Perform system health checks, diagnostics, and software maintenance.

*Provide clear, friendly communication with users while resolving technical issues.



Qualifications:

*Proven experience in IT support, helpdesk, or technical troubleshooting (Tier 2 or higher preferred).

*Strong knowledge of Windows and macOS environments, networking fundamentals, and common office applications.



Deep understanding of:

*BIOS configurations and system boot processes

*VPN setup and troubleshooting (OpenVPN, IPSec, L2TP, etc.)

*DNS management and name resolution

*Networking concepts (TCP/IP, DHCP, routing, switching, firewalls)

*Remote desktop tools (TeamViewer, AnyDesk, RDP, etc.)

*Ticketing systems such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, Jira, or ServiceNow

*Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.

*Ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, and manage multiple requests simultaneously.

*Strong customer service orientation and the ability to explain technical issues clearly to non-technical users.



Preferred Skills:

*Knowledge of basic server and database troubleshooting.

*Experience with cloud platforms such as Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, AWS, or Azure.

*Understanding of CRM systems or marketing automation tools (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, etc.).

*Familiarity with
 authentication protocols (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) and DNS records.

*Exposure to API integrations or automation tools like Zapier.

*Certifications such as CompTIA A+, ITIL, Network+, Microsoft Certified Professional, or CCNA are a strong advantage.



What We Offer:

*Competitive salary based on experience and technical skill level.

*Flexible work-from-home setup with a supportive, global team.

*Continuous training and growth opportunities in advanced IT and support technologies.

*Exposure to modern tools, cloud systems, and enterprise software.

*A collaborative environment where your technical expertise and initiative are valued.



Ready to Join Our Team?

If you’re a driven, detail-oriented tech professional who thrives in solving challenges, keeping systems running smoothly, and providing world-class support — we’d love to hear from you!



Apply now and unleash your technical superpowers! Start by filling out our short application form here: 



Before applying, take a few minutes to watch this quick video for insights into the role and what it’s like to be part of the Focus VA team: 
/share/6c9ac1841b9a4a5bbfbad09feefeca72



IMPORTANT!!!

Make sure to follow the video instructions on the form carefully — this helps us review your application faster and increases your chances of moving forward in the process.



Once your form is submitted, our team will review your application and contact you with the next steps. We can’t wait to learn more about you and hopefully welcome you to the Focus VA family!

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Sales Development Representative

Location: Remote

Schedule: Monday-Friday 12PM-9PM Eastern Daylight Time

Type: Contract





Mission with Meaning – Help homeowners keep their solar savings on-track by maintaining and protecting their solar systems.



Stable Base + Bonuses – Start at USD $1000-$2,000/month based on fit and experience, two pay days per month, and boost your income every single day with performance bonuses.



Career Launchpad – Clear promotion tracks, one-on-one coaching, and certifications that look great on your résumé.



100 % Remote, 100 % Supported – Work from home with a tight-knit global team that shares playbooks, live feedback, and daily wins.



Fast-Growing Green-Tech Company – Ride the wave of the booming renewable-energy sector while making a positive impact.



What You’ll Do



Call with Confidence – Call 120 + homeowners daily, introduce Conserva’s solar system service platform, and guide homeowners to sign the service agreement to have an inspection completed.



Be the Voice of Trust – Deliver our proven script in clear, friendly, American-style English.



Own Your Pipeline – Tag every conversation in our modern dialer so no lead gets left behind.



Smash Your Targets – Daily KPIs and monthly bonuses keep the wins coming fast.



Level-Up Together – Join live call-review huddles, share new objections you’ve cracked, and shape tomorrow’s playbook.



What Makes You a Fit



Fluent English & Empathy – Your tone builds rapport in seconds and you can simplify technical ideas for everyday homeowners.



Resilient & Goal-Driven – Rejection rolls off your back; hitting numbers fires you up.



Organized Self-Starter – You thrive in a remote setting with a reliable PC, high speed internet, and a quiet space.



Sales or Support Background – previous experience on the phone is ideal, but raw talent + grit works too—we’ll train you.



The Nuts & Bolts

Schedule: Monday – Friday, 12 PM–9 PM EDT (That’s Tuesday–Saturday, 12 AM–9 AM PH time)



Type: Independent Contractor (Full-time)



Equipment: Computer or laptop, headset, high-speed internet



Ready to Accelerate Your Earnings?



Record a quick intro – Using Loom (free), film yourself reading the script below in a bright, friendly tone.



Submit the Loom link when you apply.



We review within 48 hours. Top candidates move straight to a live interview.



Voice-Intro Script (30 seconds)



“Your system had a 25-year warranty, covering parts, inverter, and labor. However, because   Titan didn’t document maintenance, this inspection is required to confirm your system is eligible for full coverage. This inspection is a one-time $189 fee.   It includes:  A full system check to confirm everything is working, they examine every component of your system and use a drone to get Infrared thermal imaging to detect hidden   electrical issues, such as hot spots or electrical faults.                                                      Ensuring your system is still safe and compliant and still qualifies for full warranty protection..”



Take the next step toward a high-energy career with unlimited upside and a company that’s powering the clean-energy future. Apply now—Conserva can’t wait to meet you!

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Job Overview 

We’re a fast-growing Amazon agency that helps brands stand out with bold visuals, smart packaging, and scroll-stopping content. We're looking for a creative, forward-thinking designer who’s excited about the intersection of design and AI—and wants to grow with a team that values innovation and independence. 



This role is perfect for someone with a background in product label and packaging design and experience creating high-converting content for Amazon or other eCommerce platforms. You should be highly adaptable, detail-oriented, and confident using both traditional and AI-enhanced design tools. 



Responsibilities 

- Product label packaging design 

- Create short-form video and motion graphics for Amazon, Reels, TikTok, etc. 

- Design Amazon listing images, A+ content, and storefront graphics 

- Work on product packaging from concept to production 

- Use AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, Canva AI, Runway, Photoshop AI) to speed up creative workflows 

- Follow creative briefs and deliver assets on time 

- Communicate clearly and work independently 

- Adapt to fast feedback and changing project needs 



Requirements 

- Strong portfolio demonstrating Amazon/eCommerce work, product or packaging design, and video/motion graphics 

- 2 years of Ecommerce domain experience 

- Strong portfolio with design and motion/video work Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, After Effects) 

- Experience using AI design tools Work on product packaging design from concept through production, with an eye for brand consistency 

- Great eye for layout, typography, and storytelling 

- Experience with Amazon or eCommerce visuals 

- Proactive, self-motivated, adaptable, and eager to grow 

- Communicate clearly, take feedback well, and thrive in a fast-paced, independent work environment 



Join us in creating impactful designs that resonate with our audience! Submit your portfolio, a brief introduction, and your hourly rate within the range. If you’ve created anything using AI tools—show us!

title: Web Designer/Branding Expert
description:
Location: Remote

Job Type: Contract



About Us:

We are a well-established and growing accounting firm that specializes in providing comprehensive financial solutions to businesses and individuals. Our mission is to simplify accounting and tax services for our clients while fostering long-term, trusted relationships. We are looking for an experienced and creative Web Designer & Brand Expert to elevate our online presence and ensure our brand communicates professionalism, trust, and expertise.



Position Overview:

We currently have a website however, we are seeking a talented Web Designer & Brand Expert with experience in the accounting industry to redesign and optimize our website while strengthening our brand identity. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, a strong understanding of user experience, and an ability to translate our firm's values into a seamless online experience. In addition, you will work closely with our executive team to ensure that the brand’s visual identity is consistent across all touchpoints.



Key Responsibilities:



Web Design & Brand Strategy:



- Redesign and modernize the website to create a professional, user-friendly experience.

- Ensure the branding is consistent across all touchpoints (website, social media, and print materials).

- Create custom graphics, layouts, and design elements that reflect the firm's values and mission.

- Improve the website's user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) for better functionality.

- Enhance the website's performance, security, and SEO.

- Provide suggestions for branding improvements that resonate with target clients.



Experience:



- Proven experience as a Web Designer, UI/UX Designer, or Brand Strategist, with a background in the accounting sector.

- Strong portfolio showcasing web design, brand development, and digital projects.

- Experience with SEO and website analytics tools.

- Excellent attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.

- A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate effectively with tea
mbers and stakeholders.

- Experience working with accounting firms or financial services businesses is highly preferred.



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief video explaining why you're a perfect fit for this role. Be sure to include "Web Designer" in your message title. As part of your application, please review our current website 
  and provide 3 specific suggestions for improving both its design and branding. This will help us understand your approach and expertise in aligning design with business objectives.



We’re excited to review your work and see how you can help elevate our brand’s digital presence.

title: Order Processor

Enet Auto Parts is a Toronto-based automotive parts company serving customers across North America. We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Order Processor / Operations Assistant to manage daily order flow, shipping coordination, and customer updates.

Online marketplaces and basic ERPs/CRMs



Shipping portals (UPS, FedEx, DHL, Canada Post)



TeamViewer, CRM custom remote desktop tools



AI/chat tools for drafting professional customer messages



Requirements



Strong English skills (written and spoken)



Quiet, dedicated home workspace



Excellent attention to detail and time management



Ability to multitask and manage multiple orders simultaneously



Willingness to work a consistent night shift



Interest in logistics, operations, or the automotive industry



Previous experience in order processing, customer support, or operations is an advantage



Bonus: Familiarity with North American shipping carriers and e-commerce workflows



What We Offer



CAD $1,000/month stable pay (paid bi-weekly)

Long-term role with growth opportunities



Supportive international team



Performance-based raise opportunity after 3 months

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid twice per month via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

title: Video Editor
description:
About The Brand

We are a small marketing agency serving service-based businesses such as professional services and healthcare practices. We deliver strategic digital marketing that helps our clients grow businesses aligned with their values. We're a collaborative, distributed team that values creativity, efficiency, and human connection.



The Role

We're hiring our second Video Editor for our team to support growing video production needs for client social media content, website videos, and marketing campaigns. You'll work alongside our existing video editor and content creation team to deliver polished, on-brand video content across multiple platforms.



This is a remote, full-time position.



What You'll Do:

- Edit short-form video content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and

- Edit long-form content for YouTube, websites, and marketing campaigns

- Color grade, add captions, graphics, music, and brand elements to raw footage

- Adapt video content for different platform specifications and aspect ratios

- Create animations within brand guidelines to enhance video engagement

- Work within brand guidelines for multiple clients to maintain visual consistency across different client accounts

- Collaborate with the content team on video concepts and shot lists

- Organize and manage video files and project folders

- Meet deadlines for recurring social media content calendars

- Revise videos based on client feedback



What We're Looking For

Required:

- 1-2+ years of video editing experience

- Proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro is preferred but can also be Final Cut Pro)

- Proficiency in CapCut

- Motion graphics skills (After Effects)

- Strong understanding of social media video formats and best practices

- Ability to edit for different brand voices and visual styles

- Attention to detail with color correction, audio levels, and pacing

- Experience adding text overlays, captions, and motion graphics

- Reliable workflow and ability to meet deadlines consistently

- Strong communication skills for remote collaboration

- Portfolio demonstrating range of editing styles



Bonus Points:

- Experience with Canva or other design tools

- Knowledge of social media trends and viral video formats

- Experience in healthcare, coaching, or service business marketing

- Familiarity with project management tools like Notion

- Photography or videography skills



Working with Us

- Recurring work: consistent projects with multiple ongoing clients

- Creative collaboration: work with designers, content creators, and strategists who value your input

- Diverse projects: edit for different brands, industries, and content types

- Supportive team: you'll work alongside another video editor and have clear processes and feedback with a supportive manager and an involved owner of the agency

- Growth opportunity: potential to expand responsibilities and compensation as agency scales



Compensation & Details

- Full-time position

- Must be able to work during US hours - shift must occur between 7:00 PM and 3:30 AM PHT 

- Compensation based on experience



How to Apply

Please send your resume and portfolio website showing at least 10 examples of your work (should include short-form social media content AND longer form YouTube content or website videos)

title: Senior Customer Service Role
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a highly organised, proactive, and fluent English-speaking Customer Service Representative to support our operations team remotely.



This is a senior, operations-facing customer service role, not a call-centre position. You will act as a key communication link between customers, internal teams, contractors, and management, while also supporting invoicing, reporting, and operational coordination.



The ideal candidate is calm under pressure, confident handling difficult conversations, and comfortable working closely with senior leadership in a fast-paced, service-based environment.



Reporting & Collaboration



Reports directly to:

Back Office Manager

Office Manager

Works closely with:

Managing Director

Operations Manager

Field teams, contractors, and subcontractors



Working Hours

Monday to Friday: 7:30 AM – 4:30 PM

Saturday: Half-day (rotational or as required)

All hours are South Australia time, including daylight saving adjustments.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Communication & Liaison

Act as the primary point of contact for assigned customers.

Manage communication with customers, internal teams, and external contractors.

Maintain clear, professional, and timely written and verbal communication.

Set, manage, and meet customer expectations.

Conflict Resolution & Problem Solving

Handle customer complaints and service issues calmly and professionally.

Coordinate with operations, contractors, and management to resolve issues.

Proactively identify risks before they escalate.

Accurately document issues and resolutions in CRM systems.

Operations & Coordination

Coordinate job-related communication between customers and field teams.

Assist with scheduling and resource allocation support.

Manage multiple priorities without sacrificing accuracy or professionalism.

Invoicing & Payments

Issue invoices for customers within your portfolio.

Track outstanding invoices and follow up on overdue payments.

Communicate professionally regarding payments and account status.

Apply negotiation skills where appropriate, in line with company guidelines.

Reporting & Executive Support



Prepare and present a weekly executive report covering:

Customers with issues

Customers without issues

Resolved cases

Outstanding risks

New opportunities (upsells, additional services, efficiencies)

Deliver clear, structured insights suitable for executive-level meetings.

Systems & Data Management



Maintain accurate records in:

ServiceM8 (or similar service management systems)

CRM platforms

Customer portals



Confidently use:

Excel (tracking, reporting, basic data analysis)

Word (professional documents and reports)

Analyse customer and operational data to identify trends and improvements.



Required Skills & Experience

Essential

Exceptional English proficiency (spoken and written) — non-negotiable

Strong customer service and stakeholder management experience

Proven ability to handle conflict and difficult conversations

Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail

Strong problem-solving and proactive mindset

Experience with CRM and service management systems

Confident using Excel and Word

Ability to work independently in a remote environment



Preferred

Experience in construction, maintenance, cleaning, gardening, building, renovations, or similar service industries

Experience working with Australian customers or businesses

Aged 28+ preferred (professional maturity and judgment valued)

iPhone ownership (advantageous but not required)

Technical & Work Environment Requirements

Reliable personal computer (desktop or laptop)

Stable, high-speed internet connection

Quiet, professional home office environment:

No background noise (e.g. animals, traffic, household disruptions)

Suitable for professional client and internal calls



Recruitment Process

Initial Screening – HR shortlisting

Interview 1 – Managing Director

Interview 2 – Office Manager



Includes:

Simple maths assessment

Reading comprehension test

title: Real Estate Media Quality Control & Photo Editor
description:
ABOUT US



We're a rapidly growing real estate media company in the United States serving professional real estate agents. We specialize in fast-turnaround professional photography. We're scaling aggressively and need reliable help with our production operations.



---



THE ROLE: Media Quality Control & Photo Editor



You'll handle our complete photo processing and delivery workflow, allowing our team to focus on client acquisition and growth. This is systematic production work using our established tools and quality standards - not creative editing or client-facing work.



---



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



- Process raw photo files through our editing workflow

- Perform quality control on edited images

- Handle light touch-ups and corrections as needed

- Upload finalized photos to our client delivery platform

- Schedule deliveries according to service level commitments

- Track orders and status in our project management system

- Communicate any issues or questions via team chat

- Maintain our quality standards and turnaround time commitments



WORKFLOW: You'll follow our documented step-by-step process for each order. We'll train you on everything.



---



TOOLS & SYSTEMS:



You'll be trained on our complete tech stack, including:

- Cloud-based photo editing platform (AI-assisted)

- Client delivery and gallery system

- File sharing and storage (Dropbox/Google Drive)

- Project tracking (Google Sheets)

- Team communication (Slack)

- Basic photo editing tools for touch-ups



NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE WITH OUR SPECIFIC TOOLS REQUIRED - we'll train you. But you must be comfortable learning cloud-based software quickly.



---



SCHEDULE & AVAILABILITY:



- Work hours: 12pm-8pm US Central Time 

- Starting commitment: 15-20 hours per week

- Growth potential: 30-40+ hours per week as our volume increases

- Must have reliable high-speed internet (minimum 10 Mbps upload for photo files)

- Busiest days are mid-week (Tuesday-Thursday)



---



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:



MUST HAVE:

- Photo editing experience (real estate, product photography, or similar)

- Comfortable with cloud-based tools and workflows

- Extremely detail-oriented with quality focus

- Excellent written English for documentation

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Available to start within 7 days

- Comfortable with systematic, repeatable work



HIGHLY PREFERRED:

- Real estate photography or media production experience

- Experience with AI tools

- Previously worked US hours

- Fast learner who can master new tools quickly

- Self-starter who can work independently once trained



---



COMPENSATION & GROWTH:



STARTING PAY: $7/hour USD

STARTING HOURS: 15-20 hours per week  

PAYMENT STRUCTURE: Starting hourly, potential to move to per-project rate after probation period



GROWTH TRAJECTORY:

As our business scales, the right person will have opportunity to:

- Increase to 30-40 hours per week

- Transition to performance-based compensation

- Take on additional responsibilities or training roles

- Grow income significantly as volume increases



This is NOT a short-term project - we're building a long-term team.



---



WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT:



Work exclusively with one company (not juggling multiple clients)

Clear, documented processes (not "figure it out yourself")

Fast-growing business (your role grows with us)

Direct communication with leadership

We value efficiency - suggest improvements and we'll listen

Stable, recurring work (not feast-or-famine)



---



TO APPLY - ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS:



Please include ALL of the following in your application (incomplete applications will be ignored):



1. EXPERIENCE:

   • Describe your photo editing background

   • Have you worked with real estate or property photography?

   • What editing platforms/tools have you used?



2. TECHNICAL SETUP:

   • What is your internet upload speed? (Test at fast.com)

   • Do you have a backup internet option if your main connection fails?

   • What hours are you available within our 12pm-8pm Central window?



3. WORK STYLE:

   • Describe a time you maintained quality while working under tight deadlines

   • How do you handle repetitive, systematic work?

   • What do you do when you encounter a problem you don't know how to solve?



4. LOGISTICS:

   • When can you start?

   • Are you comfortable working Philippines graveyard shift long-term?

   • Are you currently working other jobs? If yes, can you commit to our schedule?



5. PORTFOLIO (if available):

   • Link to examples of photos you've edited (real estate preferred)

   • OR briefly describe your typical editing workflow



---



THIS ROLE IS NOT:

- Creative photography or artistic editing

- Client communication or customer service

- Social media management

- Sales or marketing



THIS ROLE IS:

- Systematic photo processing workflow

- Quality control and attention to detail

- Reliable, consistent execution

- Following established processes

- Contributing to a fast-growing team



---



IMPORTANT: Due to the proprietary nature of our workflows and tools, detailed information about our specific systems will be shared only with candidates selected for interviews. We'll provide everything you need to know during the hiring process.



If you're detail-oriented, reliable, experienced with photo editing, and ready to commit to this role, apply now with complete answers to all questions above.



Applications without complete answers will not be considered.

title: Technical Customer Support Specialist (Remote)
description:
About Us:

Flow is a fully digital third party call center that assists companies with their customer support service. We manage incoming chats and
s, specializing in customer support. 



As a growing company, we are actively adding services to our project list that help our customers optimize their operations. We are looking for Technical Customer Support Specialists who are not only tech-savvy but also possess exceptional problem-solving skills and a dedication to providing a "concierge-style" customer experience. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, technical environment, and has a deep understanding of system operations and their importance, we want to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:

* Critical Problem Solving: Use your strong analytical skills to troubleshoot complex technical issues and resolve them quickly while ensuring customer satisfaction.

* System Understanding: Demonstrate a deep understanding of the systems and technologies you support, explaining how each component fits together and how it impacts the customer’s experience.

* Concierge-Style Service: Provide exceptional, high-touch service with a customer-first mentality, offering tailored solutions and ensuring every interaction feels personal and valued.

* Technical Support: Assist customers with a variety of technical issues related to our products/services, including software configurations, system optimizations, and network troubleshooting.

* Fast-Paced Resolution: Work in a fast-paced environment where quick thinking and decisiveness are essential, while maintaining calm and clarity under pressure.

* Documentation and Reporting: Keep thorough records of all support tickets, interactions, and resolutions to ensure timely follow-up and continuous process improvement.

* Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product teams, and other departments to escalate and resolve complex issues.



Qualifications:

* Proven experience in a technical support or similar role preferably in a high-stakes, fast-paced environment.

* Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a strong focus on troubleshooting and understanding system dependencies.

* A deep appreciation for concierge-level customer service; always going above and beyond to ensure an exceptional customer experience.

* Ability to explain complex technical concepts to customers in clear, simple terms.

* Experience working with ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom etc).

* Comfort working in high-pressure situations with a fast turnaround time.

* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with an emphasis on empathy, clarity, and professionalism.



Technical Customer Support Specialist (Remote)

Flow is a fully managed customer support and operations partner for fast-growing SaaS, FinTech, and AI companies. We help our clients deliver world-class customer experiences through a mix of smart people, structured systems, and evolving technology.



Our work goes far beyond answering tickets — we think like our customers’ internal teams. We diagnose root causes, improve processes, and continuously raise the bar for how support should feel.



We’re now hiring Technical Customer Support Specialists who combine technical aptitude, clear communication, and founder-like ownership. If you love solving puzzles, understanding how systems fit together, and making customers feel truly taken care of — you’ll thrive here.



What You’ll Do

* Solve real problems. Investigate and resolve technical issues using critical thinking — not scripts. You’ll dig into product behavior, spot patterns, and guide customers through solutions.

* Understand the system. Learn how each component of a client’s platform works and how it affects the customer journey. You’ll be trusted to connect dots others miss.

* Deliver concierge-level service. Every interaction should feel personal, calm, and confident — whether it’s
, chat, or phone.

* Collaborate with impact. Work directly with product, engineering, and operations teams to surface insights and improve the product itself.

* Document for scale. Turn your learnings into better help docs, FAQs, and internal notes that make the next interaction faster and smarter.

* Thrive under urgency. Manage multiple priorities while staying organized and composed in fast-moving environments.??



What You Bring

* Experience in technical or software support, IT helpdesk, QA, project management, or a related customer-facing technical role (SaaS + BPO experience is a plus).

* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills — you enjoy figuring out why something broke, not just how to fix it.

* Excellent written and spoken English, with the ability to explain complex ideas simply.

* Naturally empathetic and service-oriented — you take pride in making customers feel heard and supported.

* Comfortable learning new tools, systems, and technologies quickly.?A stable home office setup with reliable internet (minimum 25 Mbps).??



Why Join Flow

* Elite environment. Work alongside global founders and experienced leaders who will challenge and mentor you.

* Continuous growth. You’ll get access to world-class training (including AI), playbooks, and systems that sharpen your communication, product thinking, and leadership skills.

* Stable, long-term role. We build teams that grow with us — many of our tea
mbers have been with Flow since the beginning (10+ years).

* Remote, flexible, and global. You’ll work with clients across the U.S. and Europe while based out of the comforts of your home.



Be part of something bigger. Flow isn’t just a BPO — we’re redefining what offshore excellence looks like.



How to Apply

If this sounds like you — proactive, thoughtful, and driven to make an impact — apply now.?

title: Virtual Assistant – Podcast Audio Production & Publishing (Freelance / Contract)
description:
We are starting a new podcast. Need help compiling the audio and edit to a final product. This is gig work, by contract. Please provide in your response, your experience, price per project and provide a minimum of 2 sample work you have done (before and final product). 



Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled and reliable Virtual Assistant with audio production experience to support the compilation, editing, and publishing of our podcast episodes. This role is ideal for a freelance professional with hands?on experience in sound editing who can take raw audio tracks and produce a polished, final podcast episode ready for public release.

The Virtual Assistant will be responsible for managing the end?to?end audio workflow—from assembling multiple audio files through to publishing completed episodes on Podbean—ensuring consistent quality, sound clarity, and timely delivery.

Key Responsibilities

Podcast Audio Production



Compile and organize raw audio tracks from interviews, intros, outros, and additional segments

Edit audio files to produce a clean, professional final episode, including:



Removing background noise, errors, and long pauses

Balancing audio levels and ensuring consistent sound quality

Splicing segments together smoothly





Insert intro/outro music, transitions, and pre?recorded segments as required



Quality Control



Review final audio to ensure clarity, consistency, and overall production quality

Confirm episode length, volume levels, and file format meet publishing standards

Flag any audio issues or missing components prior to publishing



Publishing & Distribution



Upload and publish completed podcast episodes to Podbean

Ensure episode titles, descriptions, and basic metadata are correctly entered (as provided)

Confirm successful publication and accessibility across podcast platforms



File & Workflow Management



Maintain organized audio files and version control

Follow established naming conventions and workflows

Communicate clearly regarding progress, timelines, and any technical issues



Required Qualifications



Proven experience with audio editing and sound production, preferably as a freelance or contract professional

Demonstrated experience compiling multiple audio tracks into a final published product

Proficiency with audio editing software (e.g., Audacity, Adobe Audition, GarageBand, or similar)

Experience publishing podcasts or audio content to hosting platforms (experience with Podbean is a strong asset)

Strong attention to detail and sound quality

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines



Preferred Experience & Skills



Prior work producing or editing podcast episodes

Familiarity with podcast formatting standards and best practices

Comfortable working with remote teams and digital file?sharing tools

Clear written communication and responsiveness



Work Arrangement



Freelance / Contract / Virtual

Flexible hours, task?based or per?episode engagement

Ongoing work potential based on performance and podcast schedule



Ideal Candidate Profile

You are someone who enjoys transforming raw audio into a polished listening experience. You take pride in sound quality, follow instructions carefully, and are comfortable owning the full audio production process from start to finish.

description:
Job Title: Digital Content Producer (Remote Visual Consultant)

Location: Remote



Employment Type: Part-time / Contract 



About the Role: We are seeking a  skilled Digital Content Producer with a background in Cinematography and Visual Storytelling to join our team as a Remote Visual Consultant.



Your mission is to elevate the production value of our creators' content. You won't be physically behind the camera; instead, you will act as a "Virtual Director," guiding creators through the technical and aesthetic setup of their shoots to ensure a premium, cinematic output.

Pre-Production Planning: Create "visual bibles" or mood boards for specific shoots (e.g., academic/preppy aesthetic vs. high-fashion).



Qualifications:



 Deep knowledge of lighting ratios, color science, and mobile/mirrorless camera settings.



Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical creators in a clear, patient, and actionable way.

We want to choose a teammate who not only has the technical skills but also the soft skills. Our core values:



Integrity - The ability to be honest and maintain credibility.

Initiative - The ability to assess and initiate things independently. Can be harnessed with experience.

Accountability - Can be responsible.

Adaptability - Our industry evolved rapidly, we need someone who’s willing to learn, can grow, and self-learn.



ABOUT THE WORK

RATE AND HOURS

- We also have subscription to tools that you can use.

- Part-time Work hours required: 15 - 20 hrs. per week (Flexible) After the training, your schedule or what time you work is up to you, as long as you meet the weekly output required and you can work on weekdays 4 hrs per day. It’s also important for you to communicate during your work days.

title: Egocentric Video Data Collection
description:
Project Overview:



We are collecting egocentric (first-person POV) video data of everyday household tasks recorded in real residential environments. These videos will be used for human-to-robot / humanoid training datasets.



Recording Requirements (Mandatory):



First-person (POV) recording using a head-mounted smartphone or equivalent device

Recording must reflect natural human viewpoint

Handheld, tripod, or surface-mounted recordings are NOT allowed



Video Specifications:



Resolution: Minimum 1920×1080 (1080p)

Orientation: Landscape only

Frame Rate: 60 FPS Mandatory

No slow motion

No vertical videos



Visibility & Framing Rules:



Hands and objects must be clearly visible at all times

Camera angle slightly downward

No blurred or out-of-focus footage

No faces visible (including mirrors, photos, reflections)

No IDs, documents, personal data



Content Rules:



Minimum video duration: 10 minutes per video

No idle time longer than 3 seconds

Only meaningful household tasks (kitchen, living room, bedroom, bathroom.)

No eating, drinking, washing hands, sitting idle, or unrelated activities.



Editing Rules:



Raw video files only accepted

No trimming

No filters

No overlays, effects, or text, audio



Rejection Criteria - Videos will be rejected if they include:



Vertical videos

Slow-motion recording

Phone held by hand or placed on a surface

Camera zoomed in too much

Blurry, unfocused, or unstable footage

Idle time longer than 3 seconds

Edited or trimmed videos



Eligibility:



Open to international freelancers

Must have access to a residential home environment

Ability to follow strict technical guidelines is required



Before Applying - Applicants must confirm:



They have a head-mounted recording setup

Their device supports 1080p @ 30 FPS and above.

They agree to follow all recording rules strictly



Deliverables:



Raw video files only

Uploaded to assigned cloud folder, sorted by environment



Payment Details:



Payment only for approved hours and rejected video hours are not paid.



Job Types: Part-time, Fresher, Contractual / Temporary, Freelance, Volunteer



Benefits:



Flexible schedule

Work from home



Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Sales Associate
description:
We are looking for a Sales Associate who thrives at the intersection of hospitality and technology. You won't just be "selling"; you will be a consultant for hosts, helping them navigate the technical landscape of channel management, API integrations, and direct-booking strategies.



Key Responsibilities



Needs Analysis: Conduct deep-dive discovery calls with hosts to understand their current workflow, tools being used, pain points (e.g., double bookings, high commission fees), and growth goals in order to identify which Plan works best for each host.

Product Demonstrations: Lead engaging, technical walk-throughs of our platform and 6-minute onboarding flow. You must be able to explain how calendars sync across Airbnb and other channels,  how Google Vacation Rentals visibility drives traffic.

Sales Outreach: Proactively identify and engage with high-potential STR owners and property managers brought in through our Marketing funnels..

Technical Troubleshooting: Act as a bridge between the customer and our product team during onboarding, explaining technical features and ensuring the user understands the "how-to" of our direct-booking tools.

Pipeline Management: Manage the full sales cycle from initial contact to account setup and onboarding.



Candidate Requirements



Technical Aptitude: You are comfortable discussing the technology you will be trained on. This may include API connections, iCal synchronization, and web domain basics. You can learn software quickly and explain complex features in simple, relatable, plain-English terms.

Communication Excellence: You possess a clear, neutral professional accent and a high command of the English language. This is critical as you will be communicating with a diverse, global audience of property owners.

Proven Sales Track Record: 2+ years of experience in SaaS sales, ideally within PropTech, Travel, or Hospitality.

Consultative Approach: You are a listener first. You exude confidence and excel at asking the right questions to uncover a lead's true needs.

Self-Starter Mentality: You are comfortable with "the hunt." You have the discipline to manage your own outreach schedule and hit activity targets.

Technical:  Familiarity with CRM tools (Hubspot a plus) and GSuite 



Preferred Qualifications

Experience in the Short-Term Rental industry (as a host or in a similar software role).

Understanding of SEO, with a focus on creating websites.

title: Web Developer Needed to Build a Mission-Driven Website for inara (Fintech / Community Platform)
description:
inara is a community savings platform that helps people access meaningful capital without relying on loans, interest, or predatory lenders. We’re building infrastructure around contribution-based savings systems that already exist in communities worldwide and bringing structure, transparency, and safeguards to them.



This is not a generic fintech project. This is mission-driven work focused on financial resilience, trust, and long-term impact.



What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a skilled web developer who can build a clean, modern, trustworthy website that reflects inara’s values and credibility. This site will be used by community partners, institutions, philanthropies, and early users, so clarity, polish, and restraint matter more than flash.



You should be comfortable working from written concepts and collaborating closely to translate vision into a strong digital presence.



Scope of Work

• Design and build a responsive, modern marketing website

• Pages likely include: Home, How It Works, Why inara, Pilots & Partnerships, About, Contact

• Clean, accessible UI with a strong emphasis on trust and clarity

• Mobile-first and performance-conscious

• SEO-friendly structure

• Deployed and ready for real-world use



Tech Stack (Flexible)

We’re open to recommendations. You might use Webflow, Next.js, React, or another modern stack as long as the result is fast, secure, and maintainable. Please explain your choice.



Ideal Candidate

• Strong portfolio of real, live websites (not just templates)

• Experience building marketing or product websites for startups, fintech, or mission-driven orgs

• Good design judgment and attention to detail

• Clear communicator who asks thoughtful questions

• Comfortable taking ownership of a project end-to-end

• Values long-term collaboration over quick one-offs



Nice to Have

• Experience with fintech, SaaS, or regulated industries

• Familiarity with accessibility best practices

• Ability to suggest improvements rather than just execute instructions



Compensation

Paid, project-based. Please include your proposed rate or range and how you typically scope projects like this. There is potential for ongoing work as inara grows.



How to Apply

Please include:

• A short intro about you

• Links to 2–3 relevant websites you’ve built

• Your recommended tech stack for this project (and why)

• Your estimated timeline

• Your rate or project estimate



We care deeply about how inara shows up in the world. If you take pride in building thoughtful, well-crafted work and want to contribute to something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you.



We are open to increasing the budget for exceptional candidates who demonstrate strong portfolio quality and fast turnaround.

title: Appfolio Accountant - Property Management
description:
About HouseStack

HouseStack is a fast?growing co?living property management company based in Denver, CO. We manage 48 properties (300+ residents) and leverage technology to streamline leasing, accounting, and maintenance operations. Our mission is to deliver a hands?off, high?tech experience for both investors and tenants.



Position Summary

We’re seeking a detail?oriented AppFolio Accountant to join our remote team immediately. You will be responsible for comprehensive financial operations within AppFolio, including reconciliations, billing, expense tracking, and reporting. This role reports to the Director of Operations and collaborates closely with accounting and leasing teams.



Key Responsibilities

AppFolio Accounting

Enter and reconcile rent payments, deposits, and non?rental charges

Generate and distribute owner statements, invoices, and financial reports

Financial Reconciliations

Reconcile multiple bank accounts and credit cards weekly

Investigate and resolve discrepancies promptly

Billing & Expense Tracking

Prepare monthly tenant billing, late?fee assessments, and vendor invoices

Track operating expenses, charge?backs, and owner bill?backs accurately

Reporting & Analysis

Produce monthly P&L, cash?flow, and variance analysis reports

Assist with annual budget preparation and forecasting

Process Improvement

Identify opportunities to automate or streamline workflows

Document and maintain standard operating procedures



Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (Accounting, Finance, Business) or equivalent work experience

3+ years of hands?on AppFolio experience

Proven experience reconciling multiple bank and credit?card accounts

Strong billing and invoicing background

Excellent Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP)

Detail?oriented with a commitment to accuracy

Strong written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Qualifications

Experience in co?living or multi?family property management accounting

Familiarity with QuickBooks or other accounting software

Comfortable working independently in a fully remote setting

Proactive mindset with an ability to suggest and implement process optimizations



Compensation & Benefits

Competitive monthly contractor rate (please specify your rate in PHP)

Flexible schedule; must overlap at least 2–3 hours per day with Mountain Time (UTC–06:00)

Opportunity for performance bonuses

Professional development budget



Additional Details

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 6? or 12?month initial engagement, with option to extend

Equipment: Must supply your own laptop

KPIs & Performance Metrics: Reconciliation turnaround time, accuracy rate in financial reports

Probationary Period & Review Cycle: 90?day performance review

Tools & Access Provided: Secure VPN, AppFolio access, Slack channels

Data Security: NDA and data?protection compliance required



How to Apply

Submit your résumé and a brief cover letter via onlinejobs.ph.

In your cover letter, include:

Your hourly rate expectation in PHP

Confirmation of your ability to overlap with UTC–06:00 work hours

Examples of complex reconciliations you’ve handled in AppFolio

title: Business Acquisition Origination Assistant
description:
Business Acquisition Origination Assistant 





•part-time



•work from home



•remote in the Philippines



•experience required





This is a new position for our growing small company which will play a crucial, front-end role in mergers and acquisitions (M&A). The focus will be on identifying and initiating relationships with potential business acquisition targets. This role is essential for driving proprietary deal flow —finding potential business for sale before they hit the open market. 





Key Responsibilities:



•Identification & Research: 



Research industries and local markets to identify potential businesses to acquire while focusing on lower middle-market opportunities. Must be familiar with business listing databases and come with recommendations. 



•Direct Outreach (Sourcing): Contacting, educating, and initiating relationships with business owners, often conducting cold messaging on LinkedIn and
ing outreach to find targets.



•Data Management & CRM: Maintaining databases, tracking KPIs, and ensuring accurate documentation of outreach efforts.



•Initial Evaluation & Due Diligence Support: Assessing business potential and supporting senior professionals in early-stage deal structuring and evaluation. 







Required Skills and Qualifications:



•Communication & Interpersonal Skills: Excellent written English proficiency and ability to build rapport with business owners through LinkedIn, and cold outreach
. 



•Entrepreneurial Mindset: self-starter attitude with a focus on business development and “owning” their deal pipeline.







Background requirements 



•Fluid understating of M&A financial concepts (multiples, evaluations, equity, capital stacks, etc.). 



•1+ years of experience in sales, financial services, or M&A. 







Role Type: This is a high-autonomy, high-expectation role that acts as the starting point for deal flow.

title: Google Business Profile Optimization Sprint - Medicare Insurance Agency (1-Week Project)
description:
This is a 7-day sprint project to rapidly optimize our Google Business Profile and test if we work well together.

We're a Medicare insurance agency in Florida (Pinellas, Hillsborough, Manatee, Pasco counties). We need our GBP transformed from inactive to optimized and posting-ready—FAST.

If you crush this sprint, we'll immediately offer ongoing work (GBP management + lead research, 20-30 hrs/week).



Project Scope: 7 Days

Day 1-2: Audit & Optimize



Audit current GBP listing(s), flag any duplicates

Optimize business description (we provide compliance-approved copy)

Add all service areas (4 FL counties)

Upload 10 photos minimum (office, team, service area—we provide or you source stock)

Set up Q&A section with 6 common Medicare questions (we approve answers)

Deliverable: Optimization checklist completed, before/after screenshots



Day 3-5: Content Creation



Create 6 GBP posts ready to publish



Topics: AEP deadlines, turning-65 checklist, Medicare basics, local senior resources

We provide topic list + compliance rules





Design 3 simple Canva graphics (or use stock images)

Deliverable: 6 posts drafted in Google Doc for approval



Day 6: Launch & Templates



Publish first 2 approved posts

Create 30-day content calendar (post topics + schedule)

Write 3 review response templates (positive, negative, neutral)

Deliverable: Posts live, calendar + templates in shared folder



Day 7: Report & Handoff



Pull baseline insights (if available—may be limited data)

Document what was done + recommendations for next 90 days

Record 5-min Loom walkthrough of GBP setup

Deliverable: Final report + handoff video





Final Deliverables (End of Day 7):

? Fully optimized GBP (description, photos, services, hours, categories, Q&A)

? 6 compliance-approved posts (2 published, 4 ready to schedule)

? 30-day content calendar (topics mapped to dates)

? 3 review response templates

? Recommendations doc (next steps for local SEO)

? 5-min Loom handoff video (walking through everything you did)



What You'll Need:

? Proven GBP experience (show 1-2 profiles you've managed—must have examples)

? Available 3-4 hours/day for 7 consecutive days (20-25 hours total)

? Fast executor (this is a sprint, not a slow burn)

? Fluent written English (posts must be perfect—no grammar errors)

? Understands compliance (healthcare/insurance = regulated language)

? Comfortable with Canva (basic graphics for posts)

? Responsive communication (check Slack/WhatsApp 2x daily minimum)



What We Provide:

? GBP login access (via Google Workspace)

? Brand assets (logo, colors, photos)

? Compliance guidelines (1-page doc of do's/don'ts)

? Content topic list (80+ topics pre-researched)

? Daily check-ins (15 min Zoom or async via Loom)

? Fast approval turnaround (we review your work within 4 hours)

title: Civil Works Estimator & Project Sourcing Executive
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW



We are supporting our client in engaging an experienced Civil Works Estimator to support pre-construction and bidding activities for civil and infrastructure projects. This role focuses on accurate cost estimation, quantity take-offs, and project sourcing, with the ability to work directly from civil and structural drawings, including CAD files.

The Executive Partner (ExP) will operate as a dedicated offshore professional, embedded into the client’s workflows and systems, and supported by ArkLinc’s offshoring and outsourcing delivery model.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Civil Estimating & Quantity Surveying

• Review and interpret civil, structural, and architectural drawings, including CAD files

• Break down drawings, BOQs, and project specifications to develop accurate cost estimates

• Perform detailed quantity take-offs for materials, labor, and equipment



Prepare estimates for:

• Earthworks / dirtworks

• Concrete works

• Asphalt works

• Road and bridge construction projects

• Validate project scopes, assumptions, and budgets in coordination with engineers or project managers

• Ensure estimates align with project requirements, industry standards, and best practices



Project Sourcing & Pre-Construction Support

• Support identification and tracking of potential civil and infrastructure projects

• Assist in bid preparation and pre-construction documentation

• Coordinate with suppliers, subcontractors, or internal teams as needed

• Maintain organized records of estimates, take-offs, and bid-related documents



Possible Executive Administrative Support (If Required)

• The Executive Partner is also assessed and capable of supporting executive administrative tasks if required by the client, subject to scope alignment, including:

• Calendar and
 management

• Meeting coordination and follow-ups

• Drafting reports, summaries, and internal documentation



TOOLS & SOFTWARE



The ideal candidate has experience or strong familiarity with:

• AGTEK (earthwork take-offs and modeling)

• Autodesk Civil 3D or equivalent CAD software

• Earthworks estimating software or similar tools

• Google Workspace and/or Microsoft Office 365

(All system and software access will be provided by the client. Training and on-boarding will be provided by the client.)



QUALIFICATIONS



Required:

• Proven experience as a Civil Estimator, Quantity Surveyor, or similar role

• Strong ability to read and interpret civil and structural drawings



Solid knowledge of:

• Concrete

• Asphalt

• Earthworks / dirtworks

• Familiarity with road and bridge construction projects

• Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills

• Strong written and verbal communication skills



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Degree in Civil Engineering or related field

• Licensed Civil Engineer

• Experience supporting infrastructure or large-scale civil projects



IMPORTANT NOTES

• US-CST Time Zone

• We are endorsing one (1) qualified Executive Partner for this role

• Everyone is welcome to apply

• Applications must be submitted through the designated link

• COMMENTS WILL NOT BE ENTERTAINED



WHY JOIN US?

• Permanent WFH

• Earn competitive rates in USD

• HMO provided after qualifying period

• Bonuses and Allowances if qualified

• Rate increases (performance based)



TO APPLY visit ArkLinc in LinkedIn to see job post.
